Title: Junior Consultant - Data Scientist (Intern)
Description:
We let the future guide us. Join our next generation

Vuoi fare un lavoro che sia davvero significativo e di impatto? In KPMG avrai l‚Äôopportunit√† di aiutare i clienti, la societ√†, le colleghe e i colleghi ad affrontare e risolvere le sfide pi√π attuali e complesse. KPMG Advisory offre servizi di consulenza alle imprese per affiancarle nella trasformazione del business model, nel miglioramento e nella digitalizzazione dei processi, nell'analisi e nella gestione dei rischi, nonch√© supporto nelle operazioni di finanza straordinaria.

Nel particolare, entrerai a far parte del Team di Lighthouse.

La Lighthouse √® il centro di eccellenza di KPMG Advisory che offre soluzioni di Data & Analytics sul mercato.

Unendoti al team, svilupperai soluzioni innovative attingendo dalle nostre competenze globali. Combinerai informatica, matematica, statistica e business per creare analisi predittive, presentandole e comunicandole con professionalit√† e competenza. Opererai in un ambiente orientato all'innovazione tecnologica, occupandoti di Data Science, Data Engineering, progettazione delle informazioni e Data visualization. Abbiamo ricevuto riconoscimenti internazionali per quanto riguarda la nostra capacit√† di interpretare e gestire i dati.

Nello specifico, ti occuperai di:


Analizzare e integrare fonti di dati;
Progettare database per scopi analitici;
Progettare KPI e framework di calcolo pi√π efficienti;
Analizzare processi aziendali e progettare modelli di supporto analitico;
Analizzare, progettare e implementare modelli di reportistica e dashboard di monitoraggio;
Implementare soluzioni analitiche, supportare il lancio e gestire la manutenzione delle applicazioni.


Come As You Are - Le tue competenze e caratteristiche

Questa opportunit√† √® perfetta per te se:


Possiedi una Laurea in economia, matematica, ingegneria matematica, statistica, ingegneria informatica, ingegneria gestionale o informatica;
Hai sviluppato la capacit√† di combinare competenze aziendali con competenze IT, inclusa la modellazione dei dati;
Hai sviluppato Interesse per la business intelligence/data analytics;
Hai una buona padronanza della lingua inglese, preferibilmente con esperienze di studio e/o lavoro all'estero
Possiedi conoscenza di almeno uno dei seguenti database (Oracle, SQL Server, PostgreSQL) e hai sviluppato competenze in SQL; la conoscenza di linguaggi di programmazione rappresenta un vantaggio.


Your Future With Us - Cosa troverai in KPMG


Un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo, equo e che rispetta, incoraggia e valorizza le diversit√†
Un contesto stimolante e dinamico che incentiva la creativit√† e il lavoro di squadra
Modalit√† di lavoro ibrida, per promuovere un sano equilibrio tra vita lavorativa e personale
Programmi di formazione e sviluppo avanzati per rimanere sempre aggiornati
Mindset internazionale e progettualit√† innovative
Iniziative incentrate sul benessere psicofisico


Together for Better ‚Äì I nostri valori e il nostro impegno

Leadership, lavoro in team, rispetto di ogni individualit√†, approfondimento continuo, trasparenza, impegno verso la comunit√†, integrit√†: questi sono i Valori di KPMG che danno vita a un ambiente aperto allo scambio di idee e di conoscenza, che permette ai nostri professionisti di esprimere tutto il loro potenziale.

Grazie all‚Äôimpegno nel favorire un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo, il nostro Network ha ottenuto le certificazioni ISO 30415, che attesta la conformit√† del Sistema di Gestione per la Diversit√† e l‚ÄôInclusione, e UNI PdR 125, che certifica la parit√† di genere. All‚Äôinterno del nostro Impact Plan - Our Impact Plan (kpmg.com) - trovi riassunte tutte le azioni concrete che stiamo portando avanti su tematiche ambientali, sociali e di governance (ESG).

Unisciti a noi!

I tuoi dati saranno trattati nel pieno rispetto delle disposizioni del Regolamento (UE) n. 679/2016 (General Data Protection Regulation - "GDPR") e successive modifiche. Per ulteriori informazioni, consultare l'informativa sulla privacy di KPMG.

KPMG Advisory S.p.A. garantisce le pari opportunit√†.

Title: Data Science Analyst
Description:
For the Central Team of Generali Global Corporate & Commercial (GC&C), we are looking for a Data Science Analyst to join our Insurance Department. Reporting to the Head of Technical Excellence, this position is key to leveraging data insights for comprehensive technical analysis, pricing strategies, and effective portfolio management. With a dynamic, cross-functional approach, the role includes demanding data integration across key domains such as Underwriting, Risk Engineering, and Claims, thereby contributing significantly to the company's strategic objectives. In addition, you will contribute to the development of the sustainability agenda of GC&C, working on carbon emission, green energy, and climate change initiatives.




Main responsibilities:




Portfolio Management

Supporting the analysis of the overall GC&C portfolio results, trends and patterns;
Designing and deploying the portfolio management discipline;
Implementing the portfolio monitoring tools;
Assisting BU in the target setting and supporting BU in achieving targets;
Performing data quality checks at all stages of portfolio management;
Preparation and steering of Portfolio review meetings;
Assisting UW functions in steering the business accordingly.

Innovation

Working collaboratively on pioneering new actuarial tools, integrating Machine Learning algorithms to enhance predictive capabilities;
Actively participate in defining business requirements to evolve the TechEx technology stack, in partnership with Operations;
Facilitate training sessions for the GC&C underwriting community on the TechEx tool suite, promoting skill enhancement and tool.

Sustainability and Net Zero Transition

Driving forward GC&C sustainability initiatives also in collaboration with Group Head Office;
Contributing to the development of a technical framework to embed Net Zero targets into GC&C underwriting strategy.







Requirements

The ideal candidate will meet the following requirements:




Studied Actuarial Science, Mathematics or Statistics or other quantitative disciplines, e.g. Engineering, Physics etc.
Quantitative, analytical mindset, problem solving skills
Insurance business processes knowledge experience is welcome
Ability to build lasting relationships
Strong communication and presentation skills
Familiarity with Python and R is valued
Must be fluent in Italian, English, additional languages are an advantage




Company Profile

Generali is a major player in the global insurance industry ‚Äì a strategic and highly important sector for the growth, development and welfare of modern societies.

Over almost 200 years, we have built a multinational group that is present in more than 50 countries, with 470 companies and nearly 82,000 employees. Our group aims to become the standard bearer and industry leader in the European retail insurance market, building on our existing base of 50 million retail clients, out of an overall total of 72 million.

Global Corporate & Commercial is the Generali Group unit developing P&C business and insurance services for medium and large companies. The unit acts on a global scale and deploys an integrated approach at Group level with a central management team and specialized teams active in individual countries. Through GC&C, Generali aims to become a key world player in the corporate-commercial segment.




Generali is proud to be an inclusive employer that considers applicants regardless of gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, ethnicity, disability, religion, political views, marital status or philosophy of life.

If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation or assistance, we will support you during the selection process.

Title: AI Engineer
Description:
Vuoi far parte di un'azienda tecnologia con un approccio AI-first, che modella l'invisibile fondendo l'innovazione dell'AI con l'esperienza umana?




altermAInd √® una societ√† che offre soluzioni che permettono alle organizzazioni di superare i limiti, rivelando opportunit√† nascoste e guidando una crescita trasformativa.

Siamo alla ricerca di un AI Engineer per unirsi al nostro team e sviluppare soluzioni di Intelligenza Artificiale innovative e scalabili. Se hai esperienza con LLM, Python, Docker, Kubernetes e conosci il mondo Cloud Native (Azure preferito), questa √® l‚Äôoccasione giusta per te!

Chi cerchiamo?

üîπ Ottima conoscenza di Python.

üîπEsperienza con LLM e NLP.

üîπCompetenze in containerizzazione (Docker, Kubernetes).

üîπ Familiarit√† con framework come Autogen e LlamaIndex (preferenziale).

üîπ Esperienza con architetture a microservizi.

üîπ Esperienza nella progettazione di Agentic Systems.

üîπEsperienza con ambienti Cloud Native (Azure √® un plus).

üîπ Capacit√† di lavorare in team multidisciplinari.

üîπ Passione per l‚ÄôAI e voglia di innovare.

Cosa farai?

üîπSvilupperai e ottimizzerai soluzioni AI basate su LLM.

üîπProgetterai e gestirai architetture cloud-native con Docker e Kubernetes.

üîπLavorerai con Autogen e LlamaIndex per migliorare le nostre soluzioni AI.

üîπProgetterai e implementerai architetture a microservizi per scalabilit√† ed efficienza.

üîπSvilupperai Agentic Systems per migliorare l‚Äôautonomia e la capacit√† di adattamento delle nostre AI.

üîπCollaborerai con i team di infrastruttura, automation, networking e design per garantire performance, sicurezza ed esperienza utente ottimali.

üîπContribuirai alla scalabilit√† delle nostre applicazioni AI su Azure (gradita conoscenza).

Cosa offriamo?




‚úÖ Una realt√† innovativa che cresce rapidamente, da costruire insieme.

‚úÖ Progetti all‚Äôavanguardia nel mondo dell‚ÄôIntelligenza Artificiale.

‚úÖ Crescita professionale: collaborazione con esperti di infrastruttura, automation, networking e design.

‚úÖ Ambiente dinamico e flessibile, con un sistema di Flexible Benefits completo e integrato.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Got the drive to shape the future of insurance?

At Prima, you could take on a whole new challenge. As part of our global community, you‚Äôd be in the driving seat of your career; learning and growing with a top-tier team around you. Prima is a place where no matter who you are or what your role is ‚Äî your voice is valued.

Back in 2015, we embarked on a mission: to provide great value car insurance that is designed for everyone. And we‚Äôve come a long way, we‚Äôve created a culture where we can fuel each other‚Äôs success. But we need your expertise, as we steer things in a new and exciting direction.

You‚Äôre probably thinking‚Ä¶ ‚ÄòThat sounds pretty good‚Äô. We agree.

As well as great colleagues and engaging projects, there are loads of ways we can help you do the best work of your life. We‚Äôve shaped our offering to place a focus on wellbeing, autonomy and development. We see benefits as the fuel that will empower you to succeed, if you decide to embark on this journey with us.

Step into the spotlight at Prima in the Pricing team and play a pivotal role in making Prima the most successful insurance company in the world. With the power of creativity, data and machine learning, you'll be at the forefront of our competitive advantage: predict the future and set prices accordingly.

ü§∏üèΩ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è Working in a way that works for you

We believe in work-life balance and flexibility. Whether you like working from the office, home or a mixture of both. We‚Äôll help you find a balance that works best for you. We even have a policy that means you can work from any location for 30 days a year. We trust you to steer us forward.

üèÅ The freedom to explore the possibilities

We may move fast at Prima, but we move together. We‚Äôre invested in your growth; so we‚Äôll give you access to a teaching and learning marketplace. And you‚Äôll have regular sessions with your manager to establish a personal growth plan.

üåà Our winning formula: happy and high-performing

From private medical insurance to discounted gym memberships and wellbeing initiatives: we‚Äôre here to support you. We know how important your health and well-being is, so we‚Äôll go the extra mile to help you when we can.

If it sounds like we‚Äôve got something that‚Äôs up your street, let‚Äôs see if you‚Äôve got the skills we‚Äôre looking for!

Step into the spotlight at Prima as a Data Scientist of the Pricing team and play a pivotal role in making Prima the most successful insurance company in the world. With the power of creativity, data and machine learning, you'll be at the forefront of our competitive advantage: predict the future and set prices accordingly.

As a Data Scientist at Prima, your role is crucial in leveraging the power of artificial intelligence and advanced data analytics to decode the risks and opportunities presented by each new client. Your work directly influences our company's growth and long-term success, contributing to the achievement of our strategic goals.

Are you the ideal candidate for this exciting role? Here's what we're looking for:


Academic Excellence : Impressive academic achievements in Mathematics, Physics, Engineering Mathematics, Engineering Physics, or Statistics are a plus.
Experience Not Required : No prior work experience? No problem! We're eager to invest in your talent and education.
Analytical Prowess : Strong quantitative, logical, and analytical skills are essential. At Prima, you'll tackle diverse and stimulating challenges that will put your skills to the test.
Curiosity and Innovation : We value curiosity, proactivity, and pragmatism. You'll be encouraged to pursue common goals in original and innovative ways, shaping the future with your ideas.


We're Also Interested In Candidates Who


Have international experience and are fluent in English and Italian.
Possess a solid foundation in programming and machine learning.
Know how to create and manipulate datasets using data mining languages like MySQL or Redshift.


Research shows that some people are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single criteria. At Prima we are committed to building diverse teams so please apply even if your past experience doesn‚Äôt align perfectly with the requirements. You might still be a great fit!

If you're curious about experiencing a day in the life of a Data Scientist, take a look at this video from our Head of Pricing & Underwriting Italy.

Prima is a community made up of talented and ambitious individuals. We offer equal employment opportunities and are oriented towards diversity and inclusion in the workplace. We prohibit discrimination of any kind based on race, colour, gender, religion, sexual orientation, nationality, disability, genetic information, pregnancy or other protected personal characteristics, as defined by national laws.

Title: AI Specialist
Description:

Title: AI Engineer
Description:
We are looking for an AI engineer to join our AI factory team. You will be responsible for E2E applications development leveraging AI and generative AI capabilities. Your goal will be to design and implement scalable AI systems built around deep learning and machine learning models as well as large language models.
You will collaborate in a dynamic and innovative context in close collaboration with Architects, Data Scientists and Business Translators.What you can expect from us
Design and development of innovative and cutting-edge AI solutions

Contribute to the scale-up of AI adoption through the creation of libraries and common assets

Ensure smooth operations through scalable, robust and resilient design of systems

Adopt state of the art technology and cloud-native solutions

Define best practices and standards for application design and development

What we expect from you
University degree in computer science, physics, mathematics or engineering.

2+ years of practical relevant experience in software design and implementation, ideally related to AI systems

In-depth knowledge of Software Engineering best practices, design and architectural patterns.

Experience in object-oriented software development in Python, knowledge of APIs design and implementation - additional languages are a plus.

Practical knowledge of Kubernetes and Docker.

Eager to learn and stay up to date to AI trends, technologies and framework

Excellent collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in an agile environment.

Nice to have:

Practical experience in using ML and/or AI frameworks (e.g.
KubeFlow, Langchain, Haystack, ...)
Proven experience in application development leveraging
cloud infrastructure, including cloud services usage and integration¬†
Experience in designing and developing microservices
architecture.
Knowledge
of DevOps best practices, with proven experience of deployments on Kubernetes.
Our offer to you¬†#MakeInnovationHappen: Chance to make an impact in terms of transformation.
¬†#UnlockYourPotential: Join a young and stimulating environment.
¬†#ComeAsYouAre: Working within a global team.
¬†#UnlockYourPotential: Play a role of autonomy with high visibility and exposure.
¬†#BalanceLifeAndCareer: Flexible working hours.
¬†#EnjoyTheBest: Access to our Benefits platform with a dedicated budget that you will be able to use to choose the most suitable benefits for you.
About UniCredit GroupUniCredit is a pan-European Commercial Bank with a unique service offering in Italy, Germany, Central and Eastern Europe. Our purpose is to empower communities to progress, delivering the best-in-class for all stakeholders, unlocking a better tomorrow for our clients and our people across Europe. We serve over 15 million customers worldwide. They are at the heart of what we do in all our markets. Digitalisation and our commitment to ESG principles are key enablers for our service. They help us deliver excellence to our stakeholders and creating a sustainable future for our clients, our communities and our people.

We are an equal opportunity employer. We stand together in nurturing a workplace that welcomes diverse thinking and inclusive behaviors.

Making all voices heard and leveraging "diversity of thought" regardless of gender identity, age, race, ethnicity, sexual orientation, ability, cultural background, we ensure sustainable growth and new business opportunities, a strong drive for innovation and creativity, as well as a general improvement of the work climate with positive impact on productivity, well-being and engagement of our people.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Ricerchiamo un Data Scientist da inserire nel nostro team.




Si occuper√† di:

Implementare modelli statistici e analitici avanzati su una grossa mole di dati
Risolvere problemi in domini quali: manufacturing, healthcare, bank and insurance
Mettere in produzione algoritmi con il supporto del team di ricerca

Python
SQL
Inglese fluente
laurea triennale o magistrale in materie STEM (preferibilmente informatica, fisica, ingegneria informatica)

Title: Data Scientist, Italy - BCG X
Description:
Who We Are

Boston Consulting Group partners with leaders in business and society to tackle their most important challenges and capture their greatest opportunities. BCG was the pioneer in business strategy when it was founded in 1963. Today, we help clients with total transformation-inspiring complex change, enabling organizations to grow, building competitive advantage, and driving bottom-line impact.

To succeed, organizations must blend digital and human capabilities. Our diverse, global teams bring deep industry and functional expertise and a range of perspectives to spark change. BCG delivers solutions through leading-edge management consulting along with technology and design, corporate and digital ventures‚Äîand business purpose. We work in a uniquely collaborative model across the firm and throughout all levels of the client organization, generating results that allow our clients to thrive.

We Are BCG X

We‚Äôre a diverse team of more than 3,000 tech experts united by a drive to make a difference. Working across industries and disciplines, we combine our experience and expertise to tackle the biggest challenges faced by society today. We go beyond what was once thought possible, creating new and innovative solutions to the world‚Äôs most complex problems. Leveraging BCG‚Äôs global network and partnerships with leading organizations, BCG X provides a stable ecosystem for talent to build game-changing businesses, products, and services from the ground up, all while growing their career. Together, we strive to create solutions that will positively impact the lives of millions.

What You'll Do

Our BCG X teams own the full analytics value-chain end to end: framing new business challenges, designing innovative algorithms, implementing, and deploying scalable solutions, and enabling colleagues and clients to fully embrace AI. Our product offerings span from fully custom-builds to industry specific leading edge AI software solutions.

Our Data Scientists and Senior Data Scientist are part of our rapidly growing team to apply data science methods and analytics to real-world business situations across industries to drive significant business impact. You'll have the chance to partner with clients in a variety of BCG regions and industries, and on key topics like climate change, enabling them to design, build, and deploy new and innovative solutions.

Additional responsibilities will include developing and delivering thought leadership in scientific communities and papers as well as leading conferences on behalf of BCG X. Successful candidates are intellectually curious builders who are biased toward action, creative, and communicative.

We Are Looking For Dedicated Individuals With a Passion For Data Science, Statistics, Operations Research And Redefining Organizations Into AI Led Innovative Companies. Successful Candidates Possess The Following


Comfortable in a client-facing role with the ambition to lead teams
Likes to distill complex results or processes into simple, clear visualizations
Explain sophisticated data science concepts in an understandable manner
Love building things and are comfortable working with modern development tools and writing code collaboratively (bonus points if you have a software development or DevOps experience)
Significant experience applying advanced analytics to a variety of business situations and a proven ability to synthesize complex data
Deep understanding of modern machine learning techniques and their mathematical underpinnings, and can translate this into business implications for our clients
Have strong project management skills
Fluency in both Italian and English


#BCGXjob

What You'll Bring

Requirements

Master‚Äôs or PhD degree program in Computer Research Science, Data Science, Statistics, Operations Research, or related field

Technologies


Programming: Python


#BCGXjob

Boston Consulting Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity / expression, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under national, provincial, or local law, where applicable, and those with criminal histories will be considered in a manner consistent with applicable state and local laws.

BCG is an E - Verify Employer. Click here for more information on E-Verify.

Title: Data Scientist - Internship
HTML:
Doxa √® sinonimo di ricerche di mercato e di opinione pubblica in Italia. Fondata nel 1946, si √® sempre classificata tra le aziende leader nel settore sia in termini di qualit√† che di affidabilit√†. Doxa viene scelta per indirizzare e supportare gli approcci strategici di aziende e istituzioni private. L‚Äôattenzione rivolta all‚Äôinnovazione con lo scopo di adattare le soluzioni a un mercato in continua evoluzione, insieme al rigore scientifico, √® sempre stata alla base dell‚Äôattivit√† di Doxa.


Per il nostro HQ di Milano, cerchiamo un Data Scientist da inserire in stage all'interno del Team Operations, che si occuper√† principalmente di implementare questionari CAWI/CATI/CAPI, seguire i field di raccolta dati, elaborare tavole statistiche e controllare la validit√† degli stessi.


Sotto la supervisione del manager di funzione, la persona che stiamo cercando verr√† introdotta alle attuali attivit√† di analisi dati avanzate, per le quali √® necessaria una buona conoscenza della statistica descrittiva e inferenziale e una conoscenza almeno base di algoritmi di machine learning.

A questo sono affiancate attivit√† di ricerca e test di nuovi algoritmi, per finalit√† di innovazione ed efficientamento delle procedure aziendali interne.


Requisiti:

conoscenza base del Pacchetto Office (in particolar modo Excel e Power point);

buona conoscenza di linguaggi di programmazione statistica, in particolare Python;

buona conoscenza di metodi di analisi statistica descrittiva e inferenziale;

conoscenza almeno base di algoritmi di machine learning;

conseguimento di laurea magistrale in scienze statistiche o discipline affini.


Si offre:

tirocinio extracurriculare retribuito, con reale possibilit√† di stabilizzazione in azienda;

sistema organizzativo ibrido (tra presenza e smart working)

ambiente giovane, dinamico e forte dedizione alla crescita dei profili pi√π junior.

Title: Data Science Intern
Description:
At Boston Scientific, you will find a collaborative culture driven by a passion for innovation that keeps us connected on the most essential level. With determination, imagination and a deep caring for human life, we‚Äôre solving some of the most important healthcare industry challenges. Together, we‚Äôre one global team committed to making a difference in people‚Äôs lives around the world. This is a place where you can find a career with meaningful purpose‚Äîimproving lives through your life‚Äôs work.

About The Role

The Data Science Intern will get an overall experience of working as a Data Scientist within Boston Scientific. The Role aims to give an opportunity for the candidate in executing a end-to-end Data Science Project ‚Äì mostly from project Scoping to Exploratory Data Analysis to Model building and model evaluation.

What Will Your Responsibilities Be


Perform primary data analysis of our data.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organise, analyse, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
Work with the team to improve data quality and data governance.
Apply a mixture of qualitative and quantitative analysis techniques to produce business insights that improves customer experience and product offerings.
Present findings to business owners and stakeholder.
Translate business questions into data resolutions and stories for non-technical stakeholders.


What Are We Looking For In You


Background studies in Data Analysis, Data Science, Statistics or similar roles
Strong knowledge of and experience in (academic experience or internship) reporting packages (such as Tableau, Qlik etc), databases (SQL), programming (such as R, Python etc)
Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyse datasets (using Excel, SPSS, SAS, R or Python etc)
Technical expertise such as data models, data mining and segmentation techniques are desirable
Precise, a keen eye for detail and for numbers
A willingness to learn & upskill constantly, curious by nature
Strong team player with a solution focused attitude
Great opportunity to be a part of global organisation
Our Analytics team is very ambitious, the analytics needs will very soon be transitioning to advanced analytics. So, there is a great opportunity to transition to Data Scientist role.


What We Can Offer To You


A paid internship experience (6 months of duration, renewable for 6 further months);
Working in an international environment;
Possibility to make an impact;
Fast growing and innovative environment;
A team-oriented company culture.


Location: in our offices in Milan, on a hybrid working schedule.

Start date: May-June 2025

We, Boston Scientific, are an equal employment opportunity employer. We do not and will not make any personnel decisions (like recruiting, hiring, job assignments, and promotions) based on a person‚Äôs age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law.

  • Background studies in Data Analysis, Data Science, Statistics or similar roles
  • Strong knowledge of and experience in (academic experience or internship) reporting packages (such as Tableau, Qlik etc), databases (SQL), programming (such as R, Python etc)
  • Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyse datasets (using Excel, SPSS, SAS, R or Python etc)
  • Technical expertise such as data models, data mining and segmentation techniques are desirable
  • Precise, a keen eye for detail and for numbers
  • A willingness to learn & upskill constantly, curious by nature
  • Strong team player with a solution focused attitude
  • Great opportunity to be a part of global organisation
  • Our Analytics team is very ambitious, the analytics needs will very soon be transitioning to advanced analytics. So, there is a great opportunity to transition to Data Scientist role.

What We Can Offer To You

  • A paid internship experience (6 months of duration, renewable for 6 further months);
  • Working in an international environment;
  • Possibility to make an impact;
  • Fast growing and innovative environment;
  • A team-oriented company culture.

Location: in our offices in Milan, on a hybrid working schedule.

Start date: May-June 2025

We, Boston Scientific, are an equal employment opportunity employer. We do not and will not make any personnel decisions (like recruiting, hiring, job assignments, and promotions) based on a person‚Äôs age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law.

Title: AI Strategist
Description:
At Unicredit we are looking for a Senior Data Scientist / AI Strategist to join the recently formed AI Architecture and Strategy Team. In this role you will have the possibility to be in the forefront of shaping Unicredit AI Strategy across various countries and banking domains, this ranges from Business to control functions and operation. You will be responsible for defining together with key stakeholders the target state for AI in the group alongside the evolutionary roadmap, bridging the gap between technology, innovation and business need.What you can expect from us
Stakeholder Engagement and AI Evangelization across the group at different management levels

AI strategy definition and evolution according to collected and anticipated needs, keeping track of the constantly evolving AI technological landscape.

Align Business Priorities and vision with Architecture and Factory delivery ‚Äì to bridge the gap between stakeholders and delivery squad.

Support and monitor AI Adoption across the organization including KPI tracking and reporting to top management.

Evolve AI Strategy also according to Business and group strategy including digital landscape evolution roadmap.

Help our stakeholders understand how AI can better serve or evolve a specific domain, unlocking new development opportunities for AI adoption in the group.

What we expect from you
Ideally, a senior Data Scientist with in-depth knowledge of various AI technologies and methodologies, used to interact with non-technical stakeholders.

Experience in Product Management and Evolution to help steer the effort in our Internal AI Platform development.

Top Notch communication skills; presentation and public speaking.

Experience stakeholder engagement and management, including organization senior leadership.

Experience in AI technologies adoption programs close to final users ‚Äì focus on enhancing user interaction with the technology.

Experience in demand collection (preferably in the AI domain) including selling and opportunity scouting experience
Nice to have:
Consolidated experience in AI Strategy or similar role, preferably in the FSI industry.

Consultancy background with focus on project/program proposal and activation.

Experience in Digital Strategy and governance roles.

Consolidated knowledge of AI technology from a functional perspective (e.g. what is currently possible with a certain model or stack).

Experience in buy vs make evaluation and strategy definition ‚Äì not only in the AI domain

Hand-on experience in driving strategical digital initiatives with high complexities and multiple stakeholders and counterparts.





Our offer to you¬†#MakeInnovationHappen: Chance to make an impact in terms of transformation.
¬†#UnlockYourPotential: Join a young and stimulating environment.
¬†#ComeAsYouAre: Working within a global team.
¬†#UnlockYourPotential: Play a role of autonomy with high visibility and exposure.
¬†#BalanceLifeAndCareer: Flexible working hours.
¬†#EnjoyTheBest: Access to our Benefits platform with a dedicated budget that you will be able to use to choose the most suitable benefits for you.
About UniCredit GroupUniCredit is a pan-European Commercial Bank with a unique service offering in Italy, Germany, Central and Eastern Europe. Our purpose is to empower communities to progress, delivering the best-in-class for all stakeholders, unlocking a better tomorrow for our clients and our people across Europe. We serve over 15 million customers worldwide. They are at the heart of what we do in all our markets. Digitalisation and our commitment to ESG principles are key enablers for our service. They help us deliver excellence to our stakeholders and creating a sustainable future for our clients, our communities and our people.

We are an equal opportunity employer. We stand together in nurturing a workplace that welcomes diverse thinking and inclusive behaviors.

Making all voices heard and leveraging "diversity of thought" regardless of gender identity, age, race, ethnicity, sexual orientation, ability, cultural background, we ensure sustainable growth and new business opportunities, a strong drive for innovation and creativity, as well as a general improvement of the work climate with positive impact on productivity, well-being and engagement of our people.

Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
MotorK is the leading sales and marketing technology company in Europe, specialized in the automotive sector. At MotorK our mission is to empower manufacturers and dealerships to sell more with innovative, cloud-based products and services to offer the best digital customer experience.

We are on a fast and ambitious trajectory and serving 90% of the automotive manufacturers. To continue our growth, we are hiring new talents. If you want to spark the future of the automotive world, join us.





About the Role

As a Machine Learning Engineer at MotorK, you will be pivotal in driving innovation and improving customer experience. You will develop and deploy machine learning models to power automotive maintenance prediction, product classification, and marketing asset generation. Your work will directly impact the company's revenue, customer satisfaction, and overall business success.




What You'll Do

Design, develop, and train machine learning models, including recommendation systems, predictive analytics, and classification algorithms.
Collaborate with data engineers to extract, clean, and transform large datasets from various sources.
Deploy models into production environments, ensuring scalability and reliability.
Conduct A/B testing and other experiments to evaluate the impact of machine learning models on key metrics.
Work closely with product managers and software engineers to translate business requirements into technical solutions.
Provide technical guidance and mentorship to junior ML engineers on best practices and business-oriented problem-solving.



Requirements


5+ years experience as a machine learning engineer or data scientist in a digital product environment
Strong foundation in machine learning, including deep learning and statistical modelling.
Proficiency in Python and relevant ML libraries (TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn, or XGBoost).
Experience with cloud platforms and MLOps, preferably AWS.
Ability to explain complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Passion for data-driven innovation and a desire to make a significant impact.



Benefits



Working pattern and location

40 hours per week, permanent contract¬†
Monday - Friday
Hybrid role




Benefits

Meal Vouchers (‚Ç¨7 per working day)
26 days holidays + national bank holidays¬†
Individual training paths
Opportunity to develop and move within the company
National and international mobility options¬†
Yearly team activities
Food canteen at the office




MotorK is an Equal Opportunity Employer and Prohibits Discrimination and Harassment of Any kind. Our company is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at MotorK are based on business needs, job requirements, and individual qualifications, without regard to race, colour, religion or belief, age, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate.

Title: Data Insights and Analytics Internship
Description:
UNISCITI AL TEAM

Se ti interessa l‚Äôambito Data Insights & Analytics e vuoi lavorare in un ambiente dinamico, questa √® l‚Äôopportunit√† per te!




COSA FAREMO INSIEME

Supportare con dati e insights, allineare gli input al progetto Segmented Execution (mantenimento assortimento, opportunit√† di sviluppo, principali gap da colmare)
Supportare il Data Analytics & AI Manager e i colleghi nel fornire aggiornamenti all'organizzazione attraverso comunicazioni sia agli utenti finali che agli altri stakeholder coinvolti (principalmente Sales e Trade Marketing)
Creare report, visualizzare i dati e creare dashboard (report basati su PowerBI)
Supportare i processi di data inventory e gestione dei dati (coordinare e archiviare le attivit√† di mappatura dei dati)
Acquisire conoscenze e agire come esperto delle fonti di dati e dei risultati dei modelli verso l'organizzazione







COSA TI OFFRIAMO

Prevediamo un inserimento in stage dalla durata di 6 mesi con possibilit√† di proroga, oltre a:

Work-life balance: possibilit√† di lavoro da remoto e orari flessibili
Opportunit√† di crescita: investiamo nel tuo sviluppo professionale
Ambiente inclusivo: accogliamo la diversit√† e valorizziamo l‚Äôinclusione




SEI LA PERSONA GIUSTA SE‚Ä¶

Hai una laurea triennale o magistrale, idealmente in ambito economico/aziendale
Hai un‚Äôottima conoscenza della lingua italiana e inglese
Hai una propensione verso i dettagli e possiedi forti capacit√† analitiche che ti permetteranno di generare raccomandazioni solide basate sugli insights ottenuti
Hai la capacit√† di utilizzare e comunicare i dati e forti capacit√† relazionali
Hai una conoscenza avanzata di MS Office (Map/View/Pivot/Query)
Se hai precedenti esperienze accademiche o lavorative nel campo dell'analisi dei dati, sar√† considerato un vantaggio




DOVE LAVORERAI

Sesto San Giovanni (MI), con possibilit√† di svolgere attivit√† in smartworking 12 giorni al mese




SCOPRI CHI SIAMO

Coca-Cola HBC Italia, parte del Gruppo Coca-Cola HBC, √® il principale imbottigliatore e distributore di prodotti a marchio The Coca‚ÄëCola Company sul territorio nazionale.

Impieghiamo circa 2.000 dipendenti e operiamo attraverso 6 stabilimenti: 3 dedicati alla produzione di bibite situati a Nogara, Oricola, Marcianise, 2 siti di imbottigliamento di acque minerali, Fonti del Vulture a Rionero in Vulture e Lurisia a Roccaforte Mondov√¨, e un innovativo polo situato a Gaglianico dedicato alla produzione di bottiglie in plastica riciclata (rPET) destinate all‚Äôimbottigliamento dei prodotti dell‚Äôazienda.

Ci presentiamo sul mercato come un 24/7 Total Beverage Partner, con un portafoglio prodotti in grado di coprire tutte le occasioni di consumo, dalla colazione fino al dopocena.

Il cliente al centro, pi√π forti insieme, agiamo sostenibilmente, favoriamo la semplificazione: questi sono i valori che caratterizzano Coca-Cola HBC.




LA NOSTRA PROMESSA DI INCLUSIONE

Gli ingredienti segreti di Coca-Cola HBC sono una cultura inclusiva e la valorizzazione della diversit√† delle nostre persone. Offriamo pari opportunit√† a tutti, costruendo un ambiente sostenibile in cui ogni individuo contribuisce in modo equo al successo collettivo




Le ricerche sono rivolte ai candidati dell‚Äôuno e dell‚Äôaltro sesso (L. 903/77 e L. 125/91). I candidati sono invitati a leggere sul nostro sito: www.cocacolahellenic.it/Privacystatement/

l‚Äôinformativa sulla privacy (D. Lgs. 196/2003).

  • Hai una propensione verso i dettagli e possiedi forti capacit√† analitiche che ti permetteranno di generare raccomandazioni solide basate sugli insights ottenuti
  • Hai la capacit√† di utilizzare e comunicare i dati e forti capacit√† relazionali
  • Hai una conoscenza avanzata di MS Office (Map/View/Pivot/Query)
  • Se hai precedenti esperienze accademiche o lavorative nel campo dell'analisi dei dati, sar√† considerato un vantaggio


DOVE LAVORERAI

Sesto San Giovanni (MI), con possibilit√† di svolgere attivit√† in smartworking 12 giorni al mese


SCOPRI CHI SIAMO

Coca-Cola HBC Italia, parte del Gruppo Coca-Cola HBC, √® il principale imbottigliatore e distributore di prodotti a marchio The Coca‚ÄëCola Company sul territorio nazionale.

Impieghiamo circa 2.000 dipendenti e operiamo attraverso 6 stabilimenti: 3 dedicati alla produzione di bibite situati a Nogara, Oricola, Marcianise, 2 siti di imbottigliamento di acque minerali, Fonti del Vulture a Rionero in Vulture e Lurisia a Roccaforte Mondov√¨, e un innovativo polo situato a Gaglianico dedicato alla produzione di bottiglie in plastica riciclata (rPET) destinate all‚Äôimbottigliamento dei prodotti dell‚Äôazienda.

Ci presentiamo sul mercato come un 24/7 Total Beverage Partner, con un portafoglio prodotti in grado di coprire tutte le occasioni di consumo, dalla colazione fino al dopocena.

Il cliente al centro, pi√π forti insieme, agiamo sostenibilmente, favoriamo la semplificazione: questi sono i valori che caratterizzano Coca-Cola HBC.


LA NOSTRA PROMESSA DI INCLUSIONE

Gli ingredienti segreti di Coca-Cola HBC sono una cultura inclusiva e la valorizzazione della diversit√† delle nostre persone. Offriamo pari opportunit√† a tutti, costruendo un ambiente sostenibile in cui ogni individuo contribuisce in modo equo al successo collettivo

l‚Äôinformativa sulla privacy (D. Lgs. 196/2003).

Title: Data Scientist
HTML:
Cosa ti proponiamo

All‚Äôinterno della divisione ENG DIGITAL per la business line Eng AI&Data siamo alla ricerca di una figura di Data Scientist per progettualit√† legate al Machine Learning, AI e Data Science nella nostra unit√† di sviluppo di LLM proprietari.

Quali saranno le tue attivit√† e responsabilit√†?

Sarai Responsabile Di Attivit√† Di Analisi, Sviluppo e Implementazione Di Soluzioni Avanzate Basate Sul Machine Learning, AI e Generative AI Collaborando Con Un Team Di Data Scientist Ed AI Engineer. In Particolare, Ti Occuperai Delle Seguenti Attivit√†

  • Progettare e sviluppare soluzioni di AI/ML robuste e scalabili;
  • Ottimizzare algoritmi e modelli di AI/ML;
  • Supportare la gestione dell'intero ciclo di vita di progetti di Data Science e Artificial Intelligence, dalla concezione al deployment;
  • Redigere e mantenere la documentazione tecniche relativa a Soluzioni e Modelli di AI.

Qualifiche e competenze richieste

Qualifiche Richieste

  • Almeno due anni di esperienza nello sviluppo di soluzioni Python con le principali librerie per il Machine Learning (es. Scikit Learn) e per la visualizzazione (es. Matplotlib, Plotly, Bokeh, ecc.);
  • Esperienza nell‚Äôuso di framework di deep learning e NLP (es. PyTorch, Hugging Face, Langchain);
  • Esperienza nell‚Äôuso di sistemi di versionamento del codice (es. GIT);
  • Conoscenza delle principali tecniche di valutazione delle performance di Algoritmi di AI;
  • Familiarit√† nello sviluppo di API, basate su architetture a microservizi;
  • Familiarit√† nell‚Äôuso di tecnologie cloud a supporto dello sviluppo dello sviluppo di soluzioni di AI, su almeno uno dei principali hyperscaler (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud Platform);
  • Laurea in discipline informatiche, ingegneristiche o statistiche (Master o specializzazione in ambito Data Science vengono considerati un plus):
  • Buone capacit√† comunicative e di presentazione.

Competenze Aggiuntive Preferenziali

  • Conoscenze di base della teoria dei modelli generativi e LLM;
  • Conoscenza di framework e best practice per il serving LLM in Production (es. vLLM, LLMOps,
  • Pachyderm);
  • Esperienza nella creazione di soluzioni basate su container tramite l‚Äôuso di strumenti di virtualizzazione e scaling (es. Docker, Kubernetes);
  • Conoscenza delle piattaforme Cloudera e Databricks;
  • Conoscenza del framework Ray per il calcolo distribuito;
  • Esperienza nella redazione di documentazione tecnica;

Cosa cerchiamo nelle nostre persone?

  • Ambizione, nel perseguire grandi obiettivi e nell'investire sul miglioramento continuo;
  • Proattivit√†, nell‚Äôanticipare e affrontare le sfide con iniziativa;
  • Trasparenza, nel comunicare apertamente e fornire feedback costruttivi;
  • Motivazione a migliorare e a crescere insieme agli altri, manifestando apertura al confronto per favorire la crescita collettiva e il raggiungimento degli obiettivi comuni.

Invia la tua candidatura e raccontaci come puoi fare la differenza.‚ÄØ

SEDE DI INSERIMENTO

Milano | Roma | Torino | Padova

L‚Äôannuncio √® rivolto a tutti i candidati, senza distinzione di sesso, nel rispetto del Codice delle pari opportunit√† di cui al D.Lgs. 198/2006 e ss.mm.ii.

Title: Credit Data Scientist
Description:

Il Team Credit Intelligence & Analysis √® il motore strategico che guida il monitoraggio del portafoglio creditizio. Attraverso analisi avanzate e insight data-driven, assicura la protezione del valore del credito e supporta l‚Äôevoluzione continua delle strategie di gestione.

¬†

potenziare l‚Äôefficacia del team nella lettura e sintesi dei dati, facendolo crescere in termini di capacit√† di rappresentazione delle proprie analisi e di individuazione delle aree di miglioramento di performance

¬†

Conoscenza linguaggio SAS / SQL
Conoscenza Business Intelligence (Es. Tableau)
Capacit√† di elaborare e manipolare grosse quantit√† di dati da fonti diverse

Title: AI Engineer

Requisiti:




Laurea specialistica in Ingegneria Informatica, Data Science, Informatica o discipline affini (STEM).
Minimo 2 anni di esperienza nello sviluppo software con almeno un linguaggio di programmazione, come Python, Scala o simili.
Esperienza nella progettazione di soluzioni software, strutture dati e algoritmi.

Conoscenza di algoritmi di Machine Learning e Generative AI.

Esperienza nella gestione end-to-end di progetti analitici: dall'esigenza di business alla comunicazione efficace dei risultati di analisi;







Benefit:




Auto aziendale in base alla seniority

Title: AI Developer - MILANO [DIG]
HTML:
Trasforma le tue aspirazioni professionali in una storia di successo, entra in PwC come AI Developer.

Your Perspectives

Entra a Far Parte Del Nostro Team Digital Innovation - AI Center Of Excellence In Rapida Crescita e Partecipa Allo Sviluppo Di Rivoluzionarie Applicazioni Basate Su Tecnologie Di Intelligenza Artificiale. Avrai L‚Äôopportunit√† Di

  • Sviluppare progetti basati su algoritmi di intelligenza artificiale, sia per ottimizzazioni dei processi interni o per clienti che integrati in innovative soluzioni software;
  • Contribuire attivamente alla crescita della nostra struttura dedicata all'Intelligenza Artificiale, in particolare al Natural Language Understanding e alla Computer Vision;
  • Partecipare al ciclo di vita di un prodotto basato su AI, dall‚Äôanalisi del business case, al tuning dei modelli, allo sviluppo delle componenti applicative richieste dall‚Äôapplicazione fino alla realizzazione della User Experience ideale;
  • Muoverti in un contesto organizzato, dove gli aspetti metodologici e di relazione assumono una rilevanza strategica con respiro internazionale e multiculturale;
  • Operare in un contesto organizzato, dove gli aspetti metodologici e di relazione assumono una rilevanza strategica con respiro internazionale e multiculturale;
  • Garantire l‚Äôerogazione dei deliverables di progetto concordati con il Project Manager di riferimento e con i committenti, in accordo con i vincoli di budget e quality condivisi;
  • Fornire supporto applicativo a soluzioni basate su moduli di Intelligenza Artificiale, Large Language Models e Computer Vision, sia esistenti che di nuova realizzazione.

Your unique strengths

  • Possiedi una laurea in discipline STEM;
  • Hai esperienza nello sviluppo e addestramento di modelli utilizzando tecniche di Machine Learning, Natural Language Processing e Computer Vision, sia a partire dai framework pi√π utilizzati (TensorFlow, PyTorch, Keras, Spark ML, Spark GraphX) che da servizi SaaS (Google Vertex AI, Azure Cognitive Services, OpenAI);
  • Hai esperienza nell'utilizzo di Python per lo sviluppo di soluzioni basate su AI e sei interessato a lavorare con Large Language Models come OpenAI e tecniche di Computer Vision come OCR, YoLo, etc.;
  • Hai basi di Semantic Web e conosci l‚Äôarchitettura dei motori di ricerca evoluti (Elastic Search, Solr, Lucene);
  • Hai utilizzato strutture dati NoSQL (MongoDB o componenti dell'ecosistema Hadoop);
  • Conosci approfonditamente linguaggi di programmazione object oriented come Java/Scala, C++ o Python;
  • Sei capace di mettere in pratica tecniche di "Continuous Learning" al fine di cogliere opportunit√† da nuove tecnologie senza abbandonarti alla sola attivit√† di ricerca;
  • Possiedi tecniche di ascolto attivo, capacit√† di sintesi e di problem solving;
  • Ti contraddistingui per intraprendenza e curiosit√†, spiccato senso di responsabilit√† professionale;
  • Possiedi una conoscenza avanzata della lingua inglese (parlata e scritta).

Set your expectation higher

PwC ti sorprender√† con un‚Äôopportunit√† di carriera che ti far√† sentire al centro della societ√†, dell‚Äôinnovazione e del cambiamento. Il tuo talento e la tua curiosit√† avranno tutto lo spazio che meritano e, attraverso l‚Äôidentificazione delle migliori risorse, contribuirai a garantire la qualit√† dei servizi che offriamo ai nostri clienti. In questo percorso di crescita sarai accompagnato da colleghi esperti e da una formazione continua e su misura grazie alla quale potrai mettere le tue competenze a disposizione dei clienti interni.

Feel at home

Ci prendiamo cura delle nostre persone, abbracciando le diversit√† e creando valore per i clienti, le persone e la comunit√†, nel rispetto dell'ambiente. GIVE YOUR LIFE A DIFFERENT PERSPECTIVE

Title: Downstream Data Scientist - Relocation to Saudi Arabia
Description:
Job Req ID: 15663




Description:




Aramco energizes the world economy.




Aramco occupies a unique position in the global energy industry. We are the world's largest producer of hydrocarbons (oil and gas), with the lowest upstream carbon intensity of any major producer.

With our significant investment in technology and infrastructure, we strive to maximize the value of the energy we produce for the world along with a commitment to enhance Aramco‚Äôs value to society.

Headquartered in the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia, and with offices around the world, we combine market discipline with a generations‚Äô spanning view of the future, born of our nine decades experience as responsible stewards of the Kingdom‚Äôs vast hydrocarbon resources. This responsibility has driven us to deliver significant societal and economic benefits to not just the Kingdom, but also to a vast number of communities, economies, and countries that rely on the vital and reliable energy that we supply.

We are one of the most profitable companies in the world, as well as amongst the top five global companies by market capitalization.







Overview




We are seeking a Downstream Data Scientist to join Sales & Operations Planning Division‚Äôs (S&OP) under Global Optimizer Department.

The S&OP is responsible for optimizing crude allocation and the operations of global manufacturing facilities in order to maximize revenue, increase profitability, and capture international market opportunities. The division also acts as the linear programming (LP) gatekeeper for wholly owned refineries and the integrated global MPIMS model, which is used for optimizing global crude allocation and exploration of new international markets and integration options.

Your primary role is to analyze and structure large amounts of raw live and historical data, build algorithms and solutions around the data to drive decision making within the company. Your role will be at the core of the forecasting and predictive digital strategy of the company, to support the development of state-of-the-art solution for the Downstream Digital Center.







Key Responsibilities




As the successful candidate you will be required to perform the following:

Formulate and lead multi-faceted analytic studies against large volumes of data.
Interpret and analyze data using exploratory mathematic and statistical techniques based on the scientific method.
Coordinate research and analytic activities utilizing various data points (unstructured and structured) and employ programming to clean, and organize the data.
Experiment against data points, provide information based on experiment results and provide previously undiscovered solutions to command data challenges.
Coordinate with Data Engineers to build data environments providing data identified by Data Analysts, Data Integrators, Knowledge Managers, and Intel Analysts.
Develop methodology and processes for prioritization and scheduling of projects.
Analyze problems and determines root causes.
Define company data assets (data models), spark, sparkSQL, and hiveSQL jobs to populate data models.
Work closely with all business units and engineering teams to develop strategy for long term data platform architecture







Minimum Requirements




As the successful candidate you will hold a Bachelor degree in Operations Research, Industrial Engineering, Applied Mathematics, Statistics, Physics, Computer Science, or related fields. An advanced degree is preferred.

You will have 5-7 years of professional experience in related field.
You will have Proficiency with one or more programming languages (Java, C++, Python, R, etc.).
You will be able to demonstrate experience applying data science methods to real-world data problems.
You will also have experience in utilizing visualization tools to take advantage of the growing volume of available information.







Working environment

Our high-performing employees are drawn by the challenging and rewarding professional, technical and industrial opportunities we offer, and are remunerated accordingly.

At Aramco, our people work on truly world-scale projects, supported by investment in capital and technology that is second to none. And because, as a global energy company, we are faced with addressing some of the world‚Äôs biggest technical, logistical and environmental challenges, we invest heavily in talent development.

We have a proud history of educating and training our workforce over many decades. Employees at all levels are encouraged to improve their sector-specific knowledge and competencies through our workforce development programs ‚Äì one of the largest in the world.







Country/Region: SA

Show more
HTML:
Job Req ID: 15663


Description:


Aramco energizes the world economy.


Aramco occupies a unique position in the global energy industry. We are the world's largest producer of hydrocarbons (oil and gas), with the lowest upstream carbon intensity of any major producer.

With our significant investment in technology and infrastructure, we strive to maximize the value of the energy we produce for the world along with a commitment to enhance Aramco‚Äôs value to society.

Headquartered in the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia, and with offices around the world, we combine market discipline with a generations‚Äô spanning view of the future, born of our nine decades experience as responsible stewards of the Kingdom‚Äôs vast hydrocarbon resources. This responsibility has driven us to deliver significant societal and economic benefits to not just the Kingdom, but also to a vast number of communities, economies, and countries that rely on the vital and reliable energy that we supply.

We are one of the most profitable companies in the world, as well as amongst the top five global companies by market capitalization.



Overview


We are seeking a Downstream Data Scientist to join Sales & Operations Planning Division‚Äôs (S&OP) under Global Optimizer Department.

The S&OP is responsible for optimizing crude allocation and the operations of global manufacturing facilities in order to maximize revenue, increase profitability, and capture international market opportunities. The division also acts as the linear programming (LP) gatekeeper for wholly owned refineries and the integrated global MPIMS model, which is used for optimizing global crude allocation and exploration of new international markets and integration options.

Your primary role is to analyze and structure large amounts of raw live and historical data, build algorithms and solutions around the data to drive decision making within the company. Your role will be at the core of the forecasting and predictive digital strategy of the company, to support the development of state-of-the-art solution for the Downstream Digital Center.



Key Responsibilities


As the successful candidate you will be required to perform the following:

  • Formulate and lead multi-faceted analytic studies against large volumes of data.
  • Interpret and analyze data using exploratory mathematic and statistical techniques based on the scientific method.
  • Coordinate research and analytic activities utilizing various data points (unstructured and structured) and employ programming to clean, and organize the data.
  • Experiment against data points, provide information based on experiment results and provide previously undiscovered solutions to command data challenges.
  • Coordinate with Data Engineers to build data environments providing data identified by Data Analysts, Data Integrators, Knowledge Managers, and Intel Analysts.
  • Develop methodology and processes for prioritization and scheduling of projects.
  • Analyze problems and determines root causes.
  • Define company data assets (data models), spark, sparkSQL, and hiveSQL jobs to populate data models.
  • Work closely with all business units and engineering teams to develop strategy for long term data platform architecture



Minimum Requirements


As the successful candidate you will hold a Bachelor degree in Operations Research, Industrial Engineering, Applied Mathematics, Statistics, Physics, Computer Science, or related fields. An advanced degree is preferred.

  • You will have 5-7 years of professional experience in related field.
  • You will have Proficiency with one or more programming languages (Java, C++, Python, R, etc.).
  • You will be able to demonstrate experience applying data science methods to real-world data problems.
  • You will also have experience in utilizing visualization tools to take advantage of the growing volume of available information.



Working environment

Our high-performing employees are drawn by the challenging and rewarding professional, technical and industrial opportunities we offer, and are remunerated accordingly.

At Aramco, our people work on truly world-scale projects, supported by investment in capital and technology that is second to none. And because, as a global energy company, we are faced with addressing some of the world‚Äôs biggest technical, logistical and environmental challenges, we invest heavily in talent development.

We have a proud history of educating and training our workforce over many decades. Employees at all levels are encouraged to improve their sector-specific knowledge and competencies through our workforce development programs ‚Äì one of the largest in the world.



Country/Region: SA

Title: Scientist III, Data Sciences
Description:
Work Schedule

First Shift (Days)

Environmental Conditions

Office

As part of the Thermo Fisher Scientific team, you‚Äôll discover meaningful work that makes a positive impact on a global scale. Join our colleagues in bringing our Mission to life every single day to enable our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer. We provide our global teams with the resources needed to achieve individual career goals while helping to take science a step beyond by developing solutions for some of the world‚Äôs toughest challenges, like protecting the environment, making sure our food is safe or helping find cures for cancer.

Location/Division Specific Information

The team focuses on commercial audience generation through audience segmentation, time-to-event analysis, recommendation engines, generative AI, and other forms of predictive modeling. You will work closely with experts throughout the company to develop tailored targeting strategies. Your work will be seen and used by fellow data scientists, collaborators within the business, sales representatives, and customers of Thermo Fisher. You will be expected to learn quickly and offer creative and effective solutions to novel challenges.

You will report to a member of the data science team and operate as a key asset within the Corporate Data Science Center of Excellence, a team comprised of data scientists, data engineers, business analysts, program/product managers, and others.

Key Responsibilities


Identify and embed within business functions throughout the company with high data science potential.
Move quickly to build proof of concepts, scalable solutions, and anything else required to drive business value quickly.
Leverage modern tools and techniques to develop novel insights.
Promote standard methodologies in the field, encompassing data warehousing, performance monitoring, and a balanced approach.
Work with senior members to build novel audience-creation and targeting strategies
Voracious pursuit of knowledge and an unwavering dedication to the scientific process


Keys to Success:

Education


Graduate degree in a quantitative field, such as statistics, economics, mathematics, etc.


Experience


Proven track record (3 to 6 years) applying industry standard data science tools to tackle previously unsolved problems
Ability to work independently with minimal day-to-day oversight


Knowledge, Skills, Abilities


Extensive knowledge and application of the scientific process in industry
Command of statistical topics, including distributions, hypothesis testing, and experiment design.
Sophisticated technical proficiency in Python, R, SQL, and others.
Proficiency with distributed computational frameworks, such as Spark
Foundational understanding in digital marketing, sales operations, and key performance indicators
Fluent English both written and spoken is required.

Title: JUNIOR RESEARCHER
Description:
Stiamo cercando una persona nel ruolo di Junior Researcher con passione nell‚Äôanalisi dei trend, sistematizzazione dei dati e capacit√† di sintesi attraverso la scrittura.

Ci piacerebbe entrare in contatto con una persona che voglia intraprendere un percorso per sperimentare e confrontarsi con progetti di ricerca di vario tipo: dalle desk analysis alle user research, dall‚Äôanalisi di data set allo sviluppo di report.

Farai parte del team Research, la nostra business unit multidisciplinare.

Ecco alcune delle attivit√† con le quali ci alleniamo tutti i giorni

Esploriamo tematiche di frontiera per individuare gli impatti positivi per persone, territori e comunit√†.

Sviluppiamo progetti ed eventi cross-mediali che raccontano le trasformazioni in corso e mostrano le prospettive di un futuro desiderabile.

Creiamo strumenti, metodi e contenuti per supportare lo sviluppo del business Logotel.

Diffondiamo la knowledge base Logotel nei formati e nelle modalit√† pi√π adatte per alimentare i punti di vista dei nostri 200+ collaboratori e 60+ clienti.

Cosa farai insieme a noi

Sarai fianco a fianco dell‚ÄôHead of Research, che ti guider√† nell‚Äôacquisire sempre maggiore autonomia nella gestione delle tue attivit√†, che presidierai con autonomia crescente.

In concreto:

Analizzerai trend, catturando insight insieme al nostro network di esperti interni ed esterni.

Mapperai e sistematizzerai segnali, trasformandoli in narrative, presentazioni e linee guida per i nostri progetti.

Ti confronterai con temi stimolanti (come le intelligenze artificiali generative) o complessi (come la finanza o l‚Äôevoluzione del mercato dell‚Äôenergia) e, nel tuo percorso di crescita, imparerai a trovare prospettive originali e coinvolgenti.

Nel tuo profilo non possono mancare

Un percorso universitario in Design, Scienze Sociali, Psicologia, Human-Computer Interaction o campi affini.

La capacit√† di visualizzare e rappresentare idee con strumenti come Adobe Illustrator, Miro o simili.

Una spiccata capacit√† relazionale, perch√© una buona parte del tuo lavoro sar√† a contatto con esperti e clienti.

La curiosit√† per le AI generative, che hai sperimentate per gestire attivit√† che vadano oltre la creazione di un riassunto.

La conoscenza basica delle metodologie di ricerca quali-quantitative (sai impostare una survey, sai leggere un data set e sai sintetizzare i risultati emersi da un‚Äôanalisi).

Sai cercare fonti per sviluppare scenari e report.

Sai scrivere e parlare un inglese fluido, perch√© molti dei nostri progetti sono internazionali. In pi√π, la conoscenza del francese √® molto gradita.

Sappiamo guardare oltre il curriculum. Ecco cosa conta per noi:

Oltre al tuo curriculum non ti chiediamo una lettera di presentazione. Per iniziare a conoscerci davvero ci piacerebbe invece ricevere un documento (pdf o un link, non importa) che raccolga i progetti ai quali hai lavorato. Non importa che siano project work universitari, prototipi, case study o idee che vorresti realizzare, ci√≤ che ci piacerebbe √® entrare in contatto con le tue capacit√† di analisi e le tue abilit√† creative.

Cosa offriamo

Avrai l‚Äôopportunit√† di formarti con uno stage semestrale curriculare o extracurriculare, con rimborso spese di 700‚Ç¨ e ticket da 8‚Ç¨ nelle giornate di presenza: i nostri 2500 metri quadri di spazi sono pronti ad accoglierti: con orti urbani, terrazzi e stanze per il focus individuale. √à previsto che una parte delle giornate di tirocinio si svolgano in modalit√† ibrida.

Avrai l‚Äôopportunit√† di formati in un contesto dinamico, che pone attenzione e cura alla tua crescita personale e professionale.

Logotel crede profondamente nella collaborazione, promuove diversity, equity e inclusivit√† quali valori fondanti della nostra etica aziendale.

Title: AI Software Engineer
HTML:
At Globant, we are working to make the world a better place, one step at a time. We enhance business development and enterprise solutions to prepare them for a digital future. With a diverse and talented team present in more than 30 countries, we are strategic partners to leading global companies in their business process transformation.

We seek an AI Software Engineer who shares our passion for innovation and change. This role is critical to helping our business partners evolve and adapt to consumers' personalized expectations in this new technological era.

You will get the chance to:

  • Deploy and manage AI models in production environments, ensuring reliability and optimal performance;
  • Design and develop user interfaces and front-end systems that facilitate AI functionality;
  • Integrate and manage various data sources to support AI operations, ensuring data integrity and accessibility;
  • Create and maintain APIs for seamless interaction between system components, enhancing infrastructure integration;
  • Develop scalable frameworks for AI model deployment within the company infrastructure.


What will help you succeed:

  • At least 5 years in software development, with a minimum of 2 years focused on AI-related projects;
  • Demonstrated experience in a senior or leadership role, with the ability to mentor junior team members and lead complex projects;
  • Advanced proficiency in Python and/or Java;
  • Hands-on experience with AI frameworks like TensorFlow, PyTorch, scikit-learn, and generative AI tools such as LangChain or Langraph;
  • Familiarity with software development methodologies such as Agile, DevOps, and MLOps;
  • Proven ability to work effectively with data scientists and machine learning engineers in multidisciplinary teams;
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a keen attention to delivering high-quality solutions;
  • Experience with cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud for AI solution deployment;
  • Familiarity with containerization technologies like Docker and Kubernetes for managing AI applications;
  • Knowledge of Git and CI/CD pipelines for an efficient, automated workflow;
  • Fluent English.


Create with us digital products that people love. We will bring businesses and consumers together through AI technology and creativity, driving digital transformation to positively impact the world.

At Globant, we believe in fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace where everyone feels valued and respected. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to creating a thriving and inclusive environment for all employees and candidates, regardless of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected characteristic. If you need any assistance or accommodations due to a disability, please let us know by applying through our Career Site or contacting your assigned recruiter.

We may use AI and machine learning technologies in our recruitment process. Compensation is determined based on skills, qualifications, experience, and location. In addition to competitive salaries, we offer a comprehensive benefits package. Learn more about our commitment to diversity and inclusion and Globant‚Äôs Benefits.

Title: Python Developer | Milano
Description:
Sei un/a Python Developer pronto/a a nuove sfide? Allora continua a leggere, perch√© ti stiamo cercando per un'opportunit√† di carriera unica presso un‚Äôazienda partner.

Title: Data Insights and Analytics Internship
Description:
UNISCITI AL TEAM

Se ti interessa l‚Äôambito Data Insights & Analytics e vuoi lavorare in un ambiente dinamico, questa √® l‚Äôopportunit√† per te!




COSA FAREMO INSIEME

Supportare con dati e insights, allineare gli input al progetto Segmented Execution (mantenimento assortimento, opportunit√† di sviluppo, principali gap da colmare)
Supportare il Data Analytics & AI Manager e i colleghi nel fornire aggiornamenti all'organizzazione attraverso comunicazioni sia agli utenti finali che agli altri stakeholder coinvolti (principalmente Sales e Trade Marketing)
Creare report, visualizzare i dati e creare dashboard (report basati su PowerBI)
Supportare i processi di data inventory e gestione dei dati (coordinare e archiviare le attivit√† di mappatura dei dati)
Acquisire conoscenze e agire come esperto delle fonti di dati e dei risultati dei modelli verso l'organizzazione







COSA TI OFFRIAMO

Prevediamo un inserimento in stage dalla durata di 6 mesi con possibilit√† di proroga, oltre a:

Work-life balance: possibilit√† di lavoro da remoto e orari flessibili
Opportunit√† di crescita: investiamo nel tuo sviluppo professionale
Ambiente inclusivo: accogliamo la diversit√† e valorizziamo l‚Äôinclusione




SEI LA PERSONA GIUSTA SE‚Ä¶

Hai una laurea triennale o magistrale, idealmente in ambito economico/aziendale
Hai un‚Äôottima conoscenza della lingua italiana e inglese
Hai una propensione verso i dettagli e possiedi forti capacit√† analitiche che ti permetteranno di generare raccomandazioni solide basate sugli insights ottenuti
Hai la capacit√† di utilizzare e comunicare i dati e forti capacit√† relazionali
Hai una conoscenza avanzata di MS Office (Map/View/Pivot/Query)
Se hai precedenti esperienze accademiche o lavorative nel campo dell'analisi dei dati, sar√† considerato un vantaggio




DOVE LAVORERAI

Sesto San Giovanni (MI), con possibilit√† di svolgere attivit√† in smartworking 12 giorni al mese




SCOPRI CHI SIAMO

Coca-Cola HBC Italia, parte del Gruppo Coca-Cola HBC, √® il principale imbottigliatore e distributore di prodotti a marchio The Coca‚ÄëCola Company sul territorio nazionale.

Impieghiamo circa 2.000 dipendenti e operiamo attraverso 6 stabilimenti: 3 dedicati alla produzione di bibite situati a Nogara, Oricola, Marcianise, 2 siti di imbottigliamento di acque minerali, Fonti del Vulture a Rionero in Vulture e Lurisia a Roccaforte Mondov√¨, e un innovativo polo situato a Gaglianico dedicato alla produzione di bottiglie in plastica riciclata (rPET) destinate all‚Äôimbottigliamento dei prodotti dell‚Äôazienda.

Ci presentiamo sul mercato come un 24/7 Total Beverage Partner, con un portafoglio prodotti in grado di coprire tutte le occasioni di consumo, dalla colazione fino al dopocena.

Il cliente al centro, pi√π forti insieme, agiamo sostenibilmente, favoriamo la semplificazione: questi sono i valori che caratterizzano Coca-Cola HBC.




LA NOSTRA PROMESSA DI INCLUSIONE

Gli ingredienti segreti di Coca-Cola HBC sono una cultura inclusiva e la valorizzazione della diversit√† delle nostre persone. Offriamo pari opportunit√† a tutti, costruendo un ambiente sostenibile in cui ogni individuo contribuisce in modo equo al successo collettivo

l‚Äôinformativa sulla privacy (D. Lgs. 196/2003).

Title: AI & ML Engineer
Description:
Amplifon is an Italian multinational company and the global leader in hearing care solutions and services for retail expertise, customization, and consumer care. More than 20,300 professionals every day in a network more than 9,700 points of sale across 26 countries, give back the joy of hearing, feeling, and living to thousands of people across the world.

At Amplifon we believe people are the most important component of our success. Thanks to our best-in-class Hearing Care Professionals and front and back-office Teams, we are able to put the everyday taps, pops and splashes back into the lives of our customers. We believe that it‚Äôs only through strong investment in talent engagement, continuous professional development, support, and recognition that our people can exceed every limit and build a fulfilling career.

About the Role:

As an AI/Machine Learning Engineer, you will play a crucial role in developing and deploying AI solutions on our target AI platform. You will work closely with other team members to contribute to the evolution of our AI platform, define the best practices for AI development, and deliver impactful AI-driven solutions.

Responsibilities:


Design, develop, and deploy AI solutions.
Contribute to the development and maintenance of our AI platform, including infrastructure and tooling.
Experiment with and evaluate different machine learning algorithms and techniques to solve specific business problems.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and translate them into technical solutions.
Follow best practices for AI development, including model versioning, data management, and code documentation.
Contribute to the definition and implementation of AI development best practices within the team.
Participate in code reviews and knowledge sharing sessions.
Stay up to date with the latest advancements in AI/ML and related technologies.
Deploy and monitor AI models in production, ensuring performance and reliability.
Troubleshoot and resolve issues related to AI models and infrastructure.


Qualifications:


Master's degree in a scientific or engineering domain (e.g., Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, Statistics, etc.).
Minimum of 3 years of hands-on experience in AI/Machine Learning engineering.
Proven experience with the Google Cloud Platform (GCP) suite, specifically Vertex AI, Storage, BigQuery, Cloud Functions, Cloud Scheduler, Cloud Composer.
Demonstrated experience in deploying AI use cases to production or significant experience in experimentation and model development lifecycle.
Strong programming skills in Python.
Experience with LangChain.
Solid understanding of machine learning concepts and algorithms.
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.
Strong communication and collaboration skills.
Ability to work effectively in a global team environment. ¬†¬†


Bonus Points:


Experience with deep learning frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch).
Experience with MLOps tools and practices.
Experience with Dataiku
Google Cloud certifications
Familiarity with other cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure).


Amplifon is working on boosting a Winning Culture that will lead our employees towards the future, starting from the improvement of our Winning Workplace. Aligned to this goal, we offer a hybrid working policy, allowing employees to work 9 days/month remotely.¬†
