Amplifon is working on boosting a Winning Culture that will lead our employees towards the future, starting from the improvement of our Winning Workplace. Aligned to this goal, we offer a hybrid working policy, allowing employees to work 9 days/month remotely.

Title: Data Scientist, Italy - BCG X
Description:
Who We Are

Boston Consulting Group partners with leaders in business and society to tackle their most important challenges and capture their greatest opportunities. BCG was the pioneer in business strategy when it was founded in 1963. Today, we help clients with total transformation-inspiring complex change, enabling organizations to grow, building competitive advantage, and driving bottom-line impact.

To succeed, organizations must blend digital and human capabilities. Our diverse, global teams bring deep industry and functional expertise and a range of perspectives to spark change. BCG delivers solutions through leading-edge management consulting along with technology and design, corporate and digital ventures‚Äîand business purpose. We work in a uniquely collaborative model across the firm and throughout all levels of the client organization, generating results that allow our clients to thrive.

We Are BCG X

We‚Äôre a diverse team of more than 3,000 tech experts united by a drive to make a difference. Working across industries and disciplines, we combine our experience and expertise to tackle the biggest challenges faced by society today. We go beyond what was once thought possible, creating new and innovative solutions to the world‚Äôs most complex problems. Leveraging BCG‚Äôs global network and partnerships with leading organizations, BCG X provides a stable ecosystem for talent to build game-changing businesses, products, and services from the ground up, all while growing their career. Together, we strive to create solutions that will positively impact the lives of millions.

What You'll Do

Our BCG X teams own the full analytics value-chain end to end: framing new business challenges, designing innovative algorithms, implementing, and deploying scalable solutions, and enabling colleagues and clients to fully embrace AI. Our product offerings span from fully custom-builds to industry specific leading edge AI software solutions.

Our Data Scientists and Senior Data Scientist are part of our rapidly growing team to apply data science methods and analytics to real-world business situations across industries to drive significant business impact. You'll have the chance to partner with clients in a variety of BCG regions and industries, and on key topics like climate change, enabling them to design, build, and deploy new and innovative solutions.

Additional responsibilities will include developing and delivering thought leadership in scientific communities and papers as well as leading conferences on behalf of BCG X. Successful candidates are intellectually curious builders who are biased toward action, creative, and communicative.

We Are Looking For Dedicated Individuals With a Passion For Data Science, Statistics, Operations Research And Redefining Organizations Into AI Led Innovative Companies. Successful Candidates Possess The Following


Comfortable in a client-facing role with the ambition to lead teams
Likes to distill complex results or processes into simple, clear visualizations
Explain sophisticated data science concepts in an understandable manner
Love building things and are comfortable working with modern development tools and writing code collaboratively (bonus points if you have a software development or DevOps experience)
Significant experience applying advanced analytics to a variety of business situations and a proven ability to synthesize complex data
Deep understanding of modern machine learning techniques and their mathematical underpinnings, and can translate this into business implications for our clients
Have strong project management skills
Fluency in both Italian and English


#BCGXjob

What You'll Bring

Requirements

Master‚Äôs or PhD degree program in Computer Research Science, Data Science, Statistics, Operations Research, or related field

Technologies


Programming: Python


#BCGXjob

Boston Consulting Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity / expression, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under national, provincial, or local law, where applicable, and those with criminal histories will be considered in a manner consistent with applicable state and local laws.

BCG is an E - Verify Employer. Click here for more information on E-Verify.

Siamo alla ricerca di un AI Engineer, con esperienza nello sviluppo software e nella progettazione di soluzioni basate su Machine Learning e Generative AI. Laurea specialistica in Ingegneria Informatica, Data Science, Informatica o discipline affini (STEM).
Minimo 2 anni di esperienza nello sviluppo software con almeno un linguaggio di programmazione, come Python, Scala o simili.
Esperienza nella progettazione di soluzioni software, strutture dati e algoritmi.
Conoscenza di framework per il versionamento di dati e modelli (es. MLFlow, DVC, WanDB).

Esperienza con linguaggi SQL per design, query e gestione di database, nonch√© per attivit√† di ETL.

Description:

ALTEN supporta le strategie di sviluppo dei propri clienti nelle aree dell‚Äôinnovazione, della R&D e dei sistemi informativi tecnologici.




Nato pi√π di 30 anni fa e presente in 30 Paesi, il Gruppo ALTEN si √® affermato come leader mondiale nell‚Äôingegneria e nei Servizi IT e leader Europeo per la consulenza nell'industria Life Sciences.

Monitorare e migliorare i modelli esistenti per garantire che siano sempre allineati con gli obiettivi aziendali.










Requisiti:




Almeno 3 anni di esperienza nel ruolo;
Ottima conoscenza di linguaggi di programmazione come Python, R, SQL;
Comprovata esperienza nell‚Äôutilizzo di Pyspark;
Conoscenza approfondita di analisi statistica, modellazione predittiva e tecniche di machine learning;
Ottime capacit√† di problem solving e attenzione ai dettagli;
Buone doti comunicative e capacit√† di lavorare in team multidisciplinari;
Buona conoscenza della lingua inglese.










Perch√© scegliere ALTEN?




Technological challenges




Crediamo che la tecnologia abbia un grande potenziale per migliorare il nostro futuro, per questo ricerchiamo talenti che siano motivati a costruire oggi il mondo di domani. Con il nostro portfolio clienti e i diversi progetti di R&D attivi, in ALTEN avrai modo di lavorare su progetti all'avanguardia. La nostra Technical Direction ti accompagner√† e indirizzer√† durante il tuo percorso. Avrai la possibilit√† di metterti alla prova in contesti progettuali diversi e di confrontarti con esperti del settore per ampliare sempre pi√π le tue conoscenze. Potrai unire le tue passioni e metterti in gioco professionalmente. Accetti la sfida?




Inspiring Togetherness




Ci impegniamo a favorire un ambiente di lavoro sereno e collaborativo organizzando attivit√† di team building, iniziative di aggregazione, eventi sportivi, per conoscerci meglio e condividere momenti insieme. Il successo di un gruppo si fonda sulla cooperazione e condivisione reciproca del sapere e degli interessi.




Fulfilling Opportunities




In ALTEN troverai corsi formativi all‚Äôavanguardia per accrescere le tue competenze sia tecnologiche, sia linguistiche! Tramite ALTEN Academy potrai ottenere certificazioni con alcuni dei pi√π importanti schemi internazionali come IREB¬Æ, ISTQB¬Æ e altri. Attraverso Aula Streaming, invece, avrai accesso a corsi di formazione pi√π trasversali relativi a soft skills e potrai scegliere tra 12 corsi di lingua straniera.




Sustainable commitment




Crediamo che la tecnologia sia a supporto dello sviluppo sociale e della tutela ambientale. Oltre a collaborare a progetti che mirano alla sostenibilit√†, ci impegniamo a sostenere le cause che pi√π abbiamo a cuore, avendo collaborato e collaborando, tra gli altri, con AISM, AIRC, LILT, Save the Children, Treedom, This Unique. Valorizziamo l'unicit√† e ci impegniamo a garantire che tutte le nostre persone abbiano pari opportunit√† all'interno della nostra azienda, fornendo loro gli strumenti per esprimere al massimo il proprio potenziale. Il nostro approccio alla diversit√† e all'inclusione si fonda sui principi di etica e integrit√† e rappresenta il fattore determinante per lo sviluppo di orizzonti di crescita personale e aziendale pi√π ampi. Promuoviamo l'inserimento e l'integrazione lavorativa delle persone appartenenti alle categorie protette - in base a quanto disciplinato dalla legge 68/99.










I prossimi step




Una volta ricevuto il tuo cv, ci prenderemo il tempo necessario per valutarlo attentamente.

Se sar√† in linea con questa o con altre posizioni aperte all‚Äôinterno del Gruppo, il nostro team Talent Acquisition ti contatter√† telefonicamente.




L‚Äôiter di selezione proseguir√† con un colloquio conoscitivo con l'area Business, un successivo colloquio pi√π approfondito, durante il quale potrebbe essere richiesto un test pratico, ed infine un colloquio tecnico.




L‚Äôordine e il numero delle interviste potrebbero variare a seconda delle esigenze di selezione.




In alternativa, saremo felici di conservare il tuo CV nel nostro gestionale per poterlo rivalutare per opportunit√† future. Operando in 12 diverse citt√† e altrettanti settori, potrebbero contattarti pi√π Talent Acquisition Partner e/o pi√π Business Manager, se riterranno che il tuo profilo sia in linea con i progetti e le necessit√† che stanno ricercando in quel momento.




Se dovessi identificare ulteriori offerte di tuo interesse e in linea con il tuo profilo, aspettiamo la tua candidatura per poterla valutare nuovamente.







ALTEN opera nel rispetto dei principi di diversit√†, equit√† ed inclusione, che alimentano i nostri valori. ALTEN ha l‚Äôobiettivo di abbattere ogni barriera e pregiudizio, garantendo un ambiente di lavoro accessibile ed accogliente, valutando candidature indipendentemente da genere, etnia, disabilit√† (artt. 1 e 18, legge 68/99), et√†, orientamento sessuale, religione, stato civile, convinzioni personali e politiche, appartenenza ad organizzazioni sindacali, responsabilit√† familiari e back-ground socio-economico.

Title: Data Scientist
HTML:
Cosa ti proponiamo

All‚Äôinterno della divisione ENG DIGITAL per la business line Eng AI&Data siamo alla ricerca di una figura di Data Scientist per progettualit√† legate al Machine Learning, AI e Data Science nella nostra unit√† di sviluppo di LLM proprietari.

Quali saranno le tue attivit√† e responsabilit√†?

Sarai Responsabile Di Attivit√† Di Analisi, Sviluppo e Implementazione Di Soluzioni Avanzate Basate Sul Machine Learning, AI e Generative AI Collaborando Con Un Team Di Data Scientist Ed AI Engineer. In Particolare, Ti Occuperai Delle Seguenti Attivit√†

  • Progettare e sviluppare soluzioni di AI/ML robuste e scalabili;
  • Ottimizzare algoritmi e modelli di AI/ML;
  • Supportare la gestione dell'intero ciclo di vita di progetti di Data Science e Artificial Intelligence, dalla concezione al deployment;
  • Redigere e mantenere la documentazione tecniche relativa a Soluzioni e Modelli di AI.

Qualifiche e competenze richieste

Qualifiche Richieste

  • Almeno due anni di esperienza nello sviluppo di soluzioni Python con le principali librerie per il Machine Learning (es. Scikit Learn) e per la visualizzazione (es. Matplotlib, Plotly, Bokeh, ecc.);
  • Esperienza nell‚Äôuso di framework di deep learning e NLP (es. PyTorch, Hugging Face, Langchain);
  • Esperienza nell‚Äôuso di sistemi di versionamento del codice (es. GIT);
  • Conoscenza delle principali tecniche di valutazione delle performance di Algoritmi di AI;
  • Familiarit√† nello sviluppo di API, basate su architetture a microservizi;
  • Familiarit√† nell‚Äôuso di tecnologie cloud a supporto dello sviluppo dello sviluppo di soluzioni di AI, su almeno uno dei principali hyperscaler (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud Platform);
  • Laurea in discipline informatiche, ingegneristiche o statistiche (Master o specializzazione in ambito Data Science vengono considerati un plus):
  • Buone capacit√† comunicative e di presentazione.

Competenze Aggiuntive Preferenziali

  • Conoscenze di base della teoria dei modelli generativi e LLM;
  • Conoscenza di framework e best practice per il serving LLM in Production (es. vLLM, LLMOps,
  • Pachyderm);
  • Esperienza nella creazione di soluzioni basate su container tramite l‚Äôuso di strumenti di virtualizzazione e scaling (es. Docker, Kubernetes);
  • Conoscenza delle piattaforme Cloudera e Databricks;
  • Conoscenza del framework Ray per il calcolo distribuito;
  • Esperienza nella redazione di documentazione tecnica;

Cosa cerchiamo nelle nostre persone?

  • Ambizione, nel perseguire grandi obiettivi e nell'investire sul miglioramento continuo;
  • Proattivit√†, nell‚Äôanticipare e affrontare le sfide con iniziativa;
  • Trasparenza, nel comunicare apertamente e fornire feedback costruttivi;
  • Motivazione a migliorare e a crescere insieme agli altri, manifestando apertura al confronto per favorire la crescita collettiva e il raggiungimento degli obiettivi comuni.

Invia la tua candidatura e raccontaci come puoi fare la differenza.‚ÄØ

SEDE DI INSERIMENTO

Milano | Roma | Torino | Padova

L‚Äôannuncio √® rivolto a tutti i candidati, senza distinzione di sesso, nel rispetto del Codice delle pari opportunit√† di cui al D.Lgs. 198/2006 e ss.mm.ii.

Title: Junior ‚Äì Operations Excellence AI/GenAI
Description:
Stiamo cercando una figura junior da inserire nel team di Operations Excellence di Deloitte sulla sede di Milano, che lavorer√† in modalit√† Hybrid.

All‚Äôinterno del team avrai l‚Äôoccasione di crescere occupandoti di supportare la trasformazione delle istituzioni finanziarie per le quali lavoriamo a seguito di esigenze che possono nascere dal business e contesto di mercato del cliente e/o da adeguamenti degli stessi dettati dal rispetto e aderenza alle normative bancarie/assicurative. In particolare ti occuperai di concretizzare le esigenze strategiche dei nostri clienti attraverso progetti fortemente innovativi che coprono tutta la value chain aziendale e spaziano su molteplici ambiti di competenze eterogenee e multidisciplinari.

Your Role

La risorsa Junior sar√† inserita all'interno di un team di lavoro, affiancando colleghi senior e occupandosi di:


Lavorare a stretto contatto con il team e con i clienti per comprendere le esigenze di business e tradurle in metodologie ed approcci coerenti ad esse;
Sviluppo e gestione dell‚Äôinnovazione tecnologica e strategica;
Lavorare in ambito analytics ed in progetti di digitalizzazione utilizzando strumenti e tecnologie di tendenza come data management, automatizzazione dei processi, Gen AI ecc‚Ä¶
Supportare i clienti nell‚Äôanalisi attraverso l‚Äôelaborazione e la gestione delle basi informative per identificare trend, pattern e insight rilevanti; e nella visualizzazione dei dati attraverso il disegno e lo sviluppo di report e dashboard.


Winning Requirements


Laurea/Master in ambito STEM;
Interesse per tecnologie e strumenti di AI/Gen AI, Data Management, Data Visualization (Tableau, Power BI o Qlik); e cloud computing;
Conoscenza di almeno un linguaggio di programmazione (tra SQL, Python, R). Rappresenterebbe un must la conoscenza di librerie specifiche, come Pandas, Numpy, Scikit-learn, SciPy ecc‚Ä¶
Buona conoscenza della‚ÄØlingua‚ÄØinglese;
Buona conoscenza del Pacchetto Office (Excel, PPT);
Forte motivazione a sviluppare competenze nel campo dei dati, dall'acquisizione all'analisi e presentazione e curiosit√† per le nuove tecnologie e le tendenze del settore.


Make An Impact That Matters

Deloitte √® un network leader nei servizi professionali alle imprese, presente in oltre 150 Paesi con 457 mila professionisti. Offriamo soluzioni innovative e sostenibili in Audit & Assurance, Consulting, Financial Advisory, Risk Advisory, Tax e Legal. Il nostro obiettivo √® supportare le aziende nello sviluppo e nell'implementazione di strategie al passo con il mercato.

In Deloitte la sostenibilit√† √® un tema centrale. Per questo, attraverso le strategie e le progettualit√† legate alle tematiche Environmental, Social e Governance (ESG), ci impegniamo a promuovere una crescita responsabile, sostenibile e inclusiva per il Pianeta, le nostre persone e la societ√†. Scopri di pi√π sulle nostre strategie di Corporate Sustainability, tra cui Well-being, la strategia volta a migliorare il benessere fisico, mentale e sociale delle nostre persone, affinch√© siano felici e piene di energia in tutti gli ambiti della loro vita e WorldClimate, la strategia globale di Deloitte per diventare un‚Äôorganizzazione Net Zero e per guidare scelte responsabili all‚Äôinterno e all‚Äôesterno dell‚Äôorganizzazione.

Title: Data Scientist Manager
Description:
About Us

We are Alter Domus. Meaning ‚ÄúThe Other House‚Äù in Latin, Alter Domus is proud to be home to 85% of the top 30 asset managers in the alternatives industry, and more than 5,000 professionals across 23 countries.

With a deep understanding of what it takes to succeed in alternatives, we believe in being different. Invest yourself in the alternative, and join an organization where you progress on merit, where you can speak openly with whoever you are speaking to, and where you will be supported along whichever path you choose to take.

Find out more about life at Alter Domus at careers.alterdomus.com

Job Description

This role will be working in the Data and Analytics Products group ‚Äì Data Operations team. The group leverages cutting edge technology (including Generative AI) and domain knowledge to create products to solve challenges in the alternative investment space. The data operations team is responsible of transforming unstructured, and often non-digital data into a structured and digitized format, which will be fed into various products. The team is looking for a data scientist manager to lead a team in India (once fully on-boarded with the team).

Responsibilities



Lead a team of data scientists to create and/or enhance existing data pipeline workflows
Run daily scrum meetings to ensure open communication and collaboration throughout the development cycle
Use conventional data science techniques (Data Cleaning, Data Aggregation, Machine Learning) as well as more modern techniques like Generative AI to generate structured data from non-structured sources
Current projects involve the normalization and standardization of corporate financial statements but will extend to fund statements, credit agreements, compliance certificates, and other use cases
Design and implement algorithms to generate additional insights from reported corporate financial data as well as contribute to enhance the existing process
Build robust automatic quality control process to ensure quality of outputs
Use Python, R and Databricks extensively to modify or create workflows to process, standardize, sanitize and secure data
Document new enhancements and logic changes
Collaborate with other data scientists and subject matter experts throughout the product design and implementation cycle
Help with ad-hoc projects and provide timely supports to the project team



Qualifications



Master‚Äôs degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, Financial Engineering or other quantitative fields
4-10 years of the data scientist related experience handling big data sets for targeted business use cases. Having experience in handling corporate financials data is a plus.
Strong programming skills in Python, R, and SQL. Having experience in Databricks platform, C/C++/Java is a plus.
Have strong analytical skills, critical thinking and problem-solving ability is a must
Focus on outcomes and quality of output
Good communication, organizational, and multi-tasking skills



WHAT WE OFFER:

We are committed to supporting your development, advancing your career, and providing benefits that matter to you.

Our industry-leading Alter Domus Academy offers six learning zones for every stage of your career, with resources tailored to your ambitions and resources from LinkedIn Learning.

Our global benefits also include:



Support for professional accreditations such as ACCA and study leave
Flexible arrangements, generous holidays, birthday leave
Continuous mentoring along your career progression
Active sports, events and social committees across our offices
Support with mental, physical, emotional and financial support 24/7 from our Employee Assistance Program
The opportunity to invest in our growth and success through our Employee Share Plan
Plus additional local benefits depending on your location



Equity in every sense of the word

We are in the business of equity, in every sense of the word. For us, this means taking action to ensure every colleague has equal opportunity, valuing every voice and experience across our organisation, maintaining an inclusive culture where you can bring your whole self to work, and making Alter Domus a workplace where everyone feels they belong.

We celebrate our differences, and understand that our success relies on diverse perspectives and experiences, working towards shared goals and a common purpose. Thanks to the work of our Group DE&I Committee and network of DE&I Champions, we empower all of our people to be truly invested in the alternative.

We are committed to ensuring an inclusive recruiting and onboarding process. Please contact our hiring team if you require any accommodations to make our recruitment process more accessible for you.

(Alter Domus Privacy notice can be reviewed via Alter Domus webpage: https://alterdomus.com/privacy-notice/ )

Title: AI Software Engineer
HTML:
At Globant, we are working to make the world a better place, one step at a time. We enhance business development and enterprise solutions to prepare them for a digital future. With a diverse and talented team present in more than 30 countries, we are strategic partners to leading global companies in their business process transformation.

We seek an AI Software Engineer who shares our passion for innovation and change. This role is critical to helping our business partners evolve and adapt to consumers' personalized expectations in this new technological era.

You will get the chance to:

  • Deploy and manage AI models in production environments, ensuring reliability and optimal performance;
  • Design and develop user interfaces and front-end systems that facilitate AI functionality;
  • Integrate and manage various data sources to support AI operations, ensuring data integrity and accessibility;
  • Create and maintain APIs for seamless interaction between system components, enhancing infrastructure integration;
  • Develop scalable frameworks for AI model deployment within the company infrastructure.


What will help you succeed:

  • At least 5 years in software development, with a minimum of 2 years focused on AI-related projects;
  • Demonstrated experience in a senior or leadership role, with the ability to mentor junior team members and lead complex projects;
  • Advanced proficiency in Python and/or Java;
  • Hands-on experience with AI frameworks like TensorFlow, PyTorch, scikit-learn, and generative AI tools such as LangChain or Langraph;
  • Familiarity with software development methodologies such as Agile, DevOps, and MLOps;
  • Proven ability to work effectively with data scientists and machine learning engineers in multidisciplinary teams;
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a keen attention to delivering high-quality solutions;
  • Experience with cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud for AI solution deployment;
  • Familiarity with containerization technologies like Docker and Kubernetes for managing AI applications;
  • Knowledge of Git and CI/CD pipelines for an efficient, automated workflow;
  • Fluent English.


Create with us digital products that people love. We will bring businesses and consumers together through AI technology and creativity, driving digital transformation to positively impact the world.

At Globant, we believe in fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace where everyone feels valued and respected. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to creating a thriving and inclusive environment for all employees and candidates, regardless of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected characteristic. If you need any assistance or accommodations due to a disability, please let us know by applying through our Career Site or contacting your assigned recruiter.

We may use AI and machine learning technologies in our recruitment process. Compensation is determined based on skills, qualifications, experience, and location. In addition to competitive salaries, we offer a comprehensive benefits package. Learn more about our commitment to diversity and inclusion and Globant‚Äôs Benefits.

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
About Satispay

At Satispay, we're not just reimagining payments; we're pioneering a movement toward simplicity and accessibility. Picture yourself at the forefront of innovation, leading the way in revolutionizing payments - and beyond! - across Europe, alongside a vibrant community of like-minded individuals driven by a shared vision: simplifying payments to improve everyone‚Äôs life.

Are you ready to be part of something bigger? Satispay is the place for you! Come be part of our dynamic team and help us shape the future of payments in Europe.

üöÄ Join us as a Senior Data Scientist and let's make magic happen together.

Role Overview

As a Senior Data Scientist, you will drive fintech innovation by developing predictive models and data-driven solutions to optimize products and enhance business outcomes. You‚Äôll work closely with teams to integrate machine learning models into production and help shape the future of the Satispay ecosystem.

Your Mission


Deliver impact in fintech innovation. Develop and implement data-driven solutions to shape and optimize product lines, directly contributing to customer and business success.
Analyze and drive insights. Explore and interpret datasets to uncover actionable insights, influencing product design and financial decision-making processes.
Design predictive systems. Create and optimize predictive models for fraud and credit risk to enhance the reliability and accessibility of current and prospect offerings.
Deliver and maintain production-ready systems. Ensure seamless integration of analytic pipelines and machine learning models into production, focusing on system reliability, ongoing maintenance, and continuous training to adapt to changing data and business requirements.
Collaborate and integrate. Work closely with product managers, engineers, and other teams to incorporate data science solutions into Satispay ecosystem.
Stay ahead of trends. Continuously research and adopt cutting-edge techniques and tools to ensure a competitive edge in the fintech landscape.
Enhance a data-driven culture. Support decision-making and foster a data-first mindset by delivering clear, actionable insights across the organization.


Your Ideal Profile


Proven experience in data science and fintech. You hold a Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field, paired with 3+ years of experience in data science, analytics, or a similar discipline. Ideally, your background includes work in financial services, payments and credit risk modeling.
Technical excellence. You bring extensive experience with Python or R and are well-versed in machine learning libraries such as Scikit-learn, TensorFlow, or PyTorch. Strong skills in SQL and query optimization are considered as a plus.
Modeling and problem-solving expertise. You have a proven track record in predictive modeling, statistical analysis, and machine learning techniques, including supervised and unsupervised learning.
Experience in fintech: Familiarity with financial services, credit risk modelling and payments is a strong plus.
Cloud platform proficiency. You have experience deploying machine learning models on cloud platforms such as AWS, Google Cloud Platform, or Azure.
Detail-oriented and communicative. You have a sharp eye for detail and the ability to execute complex projects. You communicate effectively, building trust and understanding across technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Passion for fintech and innovation. You are enthusiastic about working in dynamic, innovative environments where your work directly shapes financial products.
Adaptability and continuous learning. You thrive in a fast-paced environment, staying on top of industry trends, tools, and techniques to maintain a leading-edge approach.


Don't let a checklist hold you back - at Satispay, we thrive on diverse perspectives and unique strengths. Your individuality could be the missing piece to our puzzle! Even if you don't meet every skill listed above, we encourage you to apply if you're passionate about the role and believe you can contribute to our team's success.

Your Perks as a Satisperson

üôÜüèª Join an international team to grow with

üè° Hybrid working policy

üçΩÔ∏è Fuel your day with our meal vouchers

üåê Preply language platform access to expand your language skills

‚≠ê Benefit from our 1.2k company welfare budget

üöÄ Own part of Satispay‚Äôs success with our Stock Option Plan

üë©üèª‚Äçüíª Gear up with our tech equipment

ü•≥ Join us in the fun with team-building events, parties, trips, and more!

Our selection process is tailored to each role and includes at least a call with our Talent Acquisition Team, a technical evaluation, and a final in-person meeting. Your recruiter will share more insights during your first meeting with us!

Equal Opportunity Employer

At Satispay, we're proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and inclusion, welcoming individuals of all backgrounds. This opportunity is open to everyone, regardless - for instance - of race, color, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, and national origin. Join us in a workplace where everyone belongs!

Learn More About Us

Curious about our core values? Explore them here.

Title: AI Engineer
HTML:
Unisciti al nostro team AI di EY basato sulle sedi di Milano, Roma, Bari, Cagliari e Trieste e dai una svolta alla tua carriera entrando in EY.

Chi √® EY?

EY √® una delle societ√† Big 4 della consulenza. Quello che ci caratterizza rispetto alle altre aziende √® la possibilit√† di trasformare il business e il modo di lavorare dei nostri clienti, che siano grandi multinazionali, piccole imprese o pubbliche amministrazioni. La nostra cultura del lavoro si basa sulla fiducia, l‚Äôautonomia e il rispetto tra le persone, ed √® incentrata sul raggiungimento dei risultati attraverso una modalit√† di lavoro ibrida.

#TELLMEY ‚Äì Cosa dicono di noi

Questi sono i fattori pi√π influenti che hanno spinto colleghe e colleghi a sceglierci nel 2024!

  • Learning and Development: oltre 50 ore all‚Äôanno di formazione per ciascuna persona;
  • Progressione di carriera: solo negli ultimi 12 mesi il 65% delle persone di EY si √® vista riconoscere un avanzamento di carriera;
  • Salary e Benefits: con un‚Äôampia gamma di convenzioni aziendali, dalla palestra allo shopping, fino a servizi gratuiti di telemedicina e supporto psicologico;
  • Mobilit√† e opportunit√† internazionali, compresa la possibilit√† di lavorare dall‚Äôestero fino a 20 giorni senza essere in trasferta;
  • Smart working senza giornate prestabilite centralmente.

La divisione AI&Data si caratterizza per avere una forte connessione con altre aree di competenza e di supportare i clienti in programmi di trasformazione di processo, con il supporto di soluzioni innovative e integrate. Farai parte del team AI&Advanced Analytics: una struttura consolidata, con elevata expertise, caratterizzata da un team giovane.

Siamo alla ricerca di un potenziale AI Engineer che si occuper√† di:

  • Implementare soluzioni di AI Generativa con tecniche avanzate (Agenti, RAG);
  • Ottimizzare pipeline di dati e modelli AI utilizzando uno dei principali cloud provider;
  • Integrare soluzioni AI nei sistemi aziendali complessi (clienti e prodotti interni).

Chi stiamo cercando? Persone con:

  • Laurea‚ÄØin‚ÄØmaterie ingegneristiche o scientifiche;
  • 2-4‚ÄØanni di esperienza‚ÄØin progetti nel settore industriale, preferibilmente in societ√† di consulenza

Title: JUNIOR RESEARCHER
Description:
IRCCS San Raffaele Scientific Institute in Milan, Italy, is looking for a Junior Researcher to join the Experimental Imaging Center. The Center scientific activity covers the main areas of biomedical research, including preclinical, translational and experimental clinical research. As a unifying trait, our research stems from bioimaging and is aimed at using a morphological approach to investigate relevant biomedical questions. Bioimaging techniques, together with advanced computation analysis, are changing the way in which biomedical research as well as diagnosis and therapy of several diseases are undertaken.

Main responsibilities:


Human microglial cell culture
Validation of a gene therapy viral product for the immunomodulation of pathogenic microglial cells
Set up of an assay to evaluate the efficacy of the viral transduction in controlling microglial activation
smFISH/spatial transcriptomics
high resolution microscopy



The candidate we are looking for has the following skills:


Degree in Biology or similar
Competences in cell biology
Competences in cell cultures
Competences in basic microscopy



What we offer:


Type of contract: collaboration
Duration: 1 year
Place of work: IRCCS San Raffaele Hospital, Via Olgettina, number 60 - Milan (Italy)



At San Raffaele Scientific Institute, a world-renowned center of excellence for clinical and scientific activities, we believe that considering diversity and promoting an open and inclusive environment is crucial to our success. We are committed to ensure that equal employment opportunities are provided and based on merit without regard to age, religion, sex, disability, medical condition, sexual orientation, cultural and social backgrounds, gender identity or expression, national or ethnic origin, or any other legally recognized status entitled to protection under applicable laws. We offer attractive conditions and rewards appropriate to an internationally competitive research organization.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
We are looking for a skilled Data Scientist to support our organization. This role combines the responsibilities of data scientist and data analyst, focusing on leveraging statistical techniques and machine learning to optimize business processes and drive informed decision-making. The ideal candidate will work closely with stakeholders across various departments to uncover actionable insights and support our digital transformation efforts.




Main Responsibilities:

Apply expertise in deriving valuable insights from large and complex data sets, including un-structured data using a combination of statistical and computational techniques.
Understand the business operational processes that are the sources of data.
Utilize critical thinking to recognize patterns and trends in data that yield insights on the physical processes represented by the data.
Analyze large data sets to identify patterns and trends, providing clear, actionable insights that inform business strategies and decision-making for management and departmental needs.
Create and maintain data visualizations using tools like Tableau and Power BI to effectively communicate findings to non-technical stakeholders.
Implement data analytics solutions using established relational data models, in alignment with the priorities defined by the team.
Support the transition from manual reporting to automated solutions and enhance digital transformation efforts by promoting data-driven approaches.
Collaborate with Data Engineers and other team members to ensure data is properly collected, stored, and processed for analysis.
Support the organization in addressing ad-hoc data inquiries and deliver valuable insights to various departments.
Apply advanced analytical methods, machine learning, and deep learning algorithms to identify patterns, trends, and insight that help business make informed decisions.
Develop, implement, and evaluate machine learning models to predict outcomes based on historical and live data.
Collaborate with stakeholders to identify opportunities for leveraging data to drive business solutions, improve outcomes and create predictive models to provide insights that support drive business growth.

Minimum Qualifications/Experience/Skills:

Experience in data analytics, statistical modeling, and machine learning.
Bachelor's or Master's degree in Data Science, Data Analytics, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related quantitative field.
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, R, Java or R and familiarity with machine learning frameworks.
Strong foundation in statistical analysis and modeling techniques.
Experience with data visualization tools: Tableau, Power BI
Experience with statistical analytical tools and Microsoft stacks.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English for effective collaboration across teams.
Strong business acumen and the ability to understand and address business problems using data insights.
Knowledge of SQL and experience with relational databases is preferred.
Familiarity with Agile and/or Scrum methodologies is a plus.
Eagerness to learn and adapt to new technologies and techniques.
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.

Major Challenges for this position:

Navigating the complexity of large and diverse data sets to extract meaningful insights.
Balancing multiple stakeholders needs and priorities while delivering timely and accurate analysis.
Keeping up with rapidly evolving technologies and methodologies in data science and analytics.
Ensuring data quality and integrity amid varying data sources and formats.

Title: AI / ML Engineer
Description:
RED are currently looking for a AI/ML Engineer to work on a project with a key client of ours in Zurich, Switzerland. This role is a potentially long term contract starting out at 6 months + possible extensions and requires someone who can work hybrid in Zurich.




We are looking for skills in the following:




Experience in designing and building high-performant AI agents and virtual chatbots using MS Copilot Studio.
Experience in automating workflows using Power Automate (e.g. calling APIs from Power Automate triggers)
Strong engineering mindset, with experience in using CI/CD, Git, Gitlab, automated testing
5+ years of experience in developing AI and Machine learning workloads, especially in the field of Natural Language Processing (NLP)
Experience in building Generative AI solutions, virtual assistants and chatbots using Azure Open AI or any similar LLM‚Äôs (eg: GPT 4.0)
Expertise in Python programming for Data science workloads
Expertise in automation and production deployment of NLP and GenAI models using PowerApps.




If this sounds like an opportunity that is of interest then please send us your CV and someone from the team will be in touch to discuss the role in more detail.

Title: Junior Data Scientist (Intern) ‚Äì 6 Month (100%)
Description:
To strengthen our Technology Innovation department, we are looking for a new team member. Join us for a six-month internship at our centrally located office in Basel, Switzerland, with the potential to advance into a permanent position.

As a Data Scientist Intern, you will be responsible for assisting with the development, experimentation and creation of machine learning, statistics and cutting-edge mathematical algorithms for various applications with a focus on NLP and/or Graph Machine Learning. You will be also supporting the Team analytics to analyze data and deploy support Business Dashboard for the management. As part of our commitment to fostering a collaborative team environment, this role requires working fully on-site.

Tasks & Responsibilities


Supporting the AI team to develop applications in the area of Natural Language Processing and Graph Machine Learning.
Developing, optimizing and evaluating new Machine Learning and Statistical models.
Finding new approaches and algorithms that solve specific business problems.
Investigating and comparing research prototypes.


Requirements


BSc or MSC studies in Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Physics or Computer Science.
Practical or student project experience in Data Science field developing useful machine learning applications.
Theoretical and technical knowledge of machine learning and deep learning algorithms.
Proficiency in Python, including statistical and machine learning libraries (other languages are a plus, e.g. R).
Experience with Deep Learning development framework (Pytorch, TensorFlow) is beneficial.
Experience in applying and implementing NLP and/or Graph Machine Learning is beneficial.
Solid verbal and written communication skills with the ability to articulate, document, share and pursue ideas and results to technical and non-technical audiences (fluency in English is a must).
Creative team player with a results-oriented mindset.
Analytical thinking


What We Offer


The opportunity to contribute to the academic/scientific community;
Flexible working hours;
Team bond strengthening through team-building events;
Professional growth opportunities with our global training system;
Working in a collaborative, diverse, and socially responsible team;
Company retreat facility;
Full-coverage insurance for accidents/daily sickness;
Prime location near Basel train station and city center;
And more


If you are interested in this position, we look forward to receiving:


A motivational letter(EN) that briefly describes your motivations for joining MDPI
A resume(EN) including personal information, past & current education,
If available: reference letters and certificates.


About MDPI

A pioneer in scholarly open access publishing, MDPI has supported academic communities since 1996. Our mission is to foster open scientific exchange in all forms, across all disciplines. We operate more than 400 diverse, peer-reviewed, open access journals supported by over 66,000 academic editors. We serve scholars from around the world to ensure the latest research is openly and broadly available.

MDPI is headquartered in Switzerland with additional offices in Europe, Asia and North America. We are committed to ensuring that high quality research is made available as quickly as possible. We also support sustainability projects, with sustainability as a key theme in many journals and through the MDPI Sustainability Foundation.

Initiatives

At MDPI, we develop and maintain various platforms in order to better serve the scientific community. Please find here-below a list of our main platforms:



https://www.mdpi.com

https://www.mdpi.com/books/

https://sciprofiles.com

https://sciforum.net

https://www.scilit.net

https://www.preprints.org

https://encyclopedia.pub

Title: Biomedical data scientist
Description:
Description

Health monitoring is a fast growing market. The trend is to gather and analyze the vitals to motivate people improving their health and to detect early medical risks. The challenge is to integrate an increasing number of sensors that measure vitals more accurately and to have a system that performs continuous tracking.

Senbiosys has developed a new generation of sensors with a high quality of signal and a significant reduction in power consumption, recently achieving a new world record. Our technology allows continuous vitals measurement such as heart rate and blood oxygen saturation with a higher precision. Our goal is to go beyond the state of the art of the vitals detection and to become a leader that improves the future of health monitoring.

We are looking for a talented Biomedical Signal Data Scientist, who will explore and develop the different signal processing schemes for our technology. We need someone that can implement new solutions to open new trends for data science and leverage the link between our unique technology and a better detection of health parameters.

Your mission

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Develop a medical database on a large enough population to correlate the PPG signal out of our sensor with medical parameters such us heart rate variability, oxygen saturation and blood pressure

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Interface with leading academic partners or specialized medical institutions for joint projects

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Actively contribute to define the right medical devices to measure the reference health parameters and benchmark our sensor through solid statistical approaches and protocols

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Develop and optimize algorithms to correlate the PPG signal with the reference health parameters

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Develop AI schemes to refine and enhance the correlation between the PPG signal properties and the reference health parameters

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Interface with the embedded software engineering team

¬†

¬†

What you can expect

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†An adventure with great talents that want to change the future of health monitoring

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†An environment in which you can grow and share new ideas

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†A flexible working model

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†As a member of a very motivated, multicultural team, you can expect new challenges every day

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Mentoring and targeted developments in new topics

Your profile

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†MSc Or PhD in biomedical engineer, computer science, electrical engineering or related fields.

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Proven understanding of biomedical signal processing (in the time domain, eventually for PPG signals is a plus).

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Proven proficiency on Python

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Understanding of artificial intelligence schemes

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Good programming skills, C programming would be a plus

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Good English proficiency

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Good communication skills

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†European citizenship or work permit in Switzerland

Additional preferred qualification

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Familiar with processing of other biomedical signals like ECG, ICG or BCG

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Experience with projects held with medical partners

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Open-minded

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†creative, problem-solving skills

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Good sense of humor

Title: Research Scientist
Description:
We are currently seeking a highly skilled and dedicated Research Scientist to join our client's R&D team in Zurich!

Responsibilities

Plan, coordinate, and carry out internal and external R&D projects
Develop and manage a detailed project and work plan
Coach and supervise laboratory work and compliance with standards
Support product development
Manage contracts with vendors and suppliers by assigning tasks and communicating expected deliverables
Prepare reports and present experimental results at group and project meetings
Good command of English in communication and writing
Travel to other business locations within the EU
Hands-on laboratory work with cytostatic chemicals
Occasional weekend work may be required

Qualifications

B.S. or M.Sc. with a sound background in cell biology and cell culture technology
2 years professional experience in industry or academic institutions
Experiences in managing scientific projects and/or collaborations
Cell culture expertise
Hands-on experience in 3D tumor models
Experience with lab automation is an advantage
Team player and multitasker

For further information about this position, please apply with your CV

*Please note, only those with the right to work in Switzerland or EU passport holders can apply!*

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
About Us:

Duferco is a global company with diverse interests spanning energy retail and trading, steel manufacturing, insurance, and logistics. Innovation has always driven our success and continues to shape our future. Our Corporate Innovation Team operates in a start-up-like, corporate-backed environment, focused on exploring, nurturing, and implementing cutting-edge ideas, technologies, and strategies to propel our organization to new heights.

At Duferco, we value talent, proactivity, and passion. We foster a culture where every team member is empowered to take ownership of their work, actively contribute to the team‚Äôs success, and grow professionally by taking on increasing responsibility. Collaboration, continuous learning, and a shared drive for innovation are central to our ethos. If you are self-motivated, eager to make an impact, and passionate about tackling challenges head-on, you‚Äôll thrive here.

As we continue to expand and diversify our operations, we are seeking a highly skilled Data Scientist to join our dynamic team. In this role, you will be instrumental in advancing our mission to use advanced analytics and machine learning to drive innovation and excellence across our diverse portfolio of businesses. If you are passionate about pushing the boundaries of applied data science, acting swiftly, and exploring new technologies that can make a significant impact on our business, we would love to hear from you.




Responsibilities:

Develop, implement, and optimize data science solutions for various applications, including industrial manufacturing, energy retail, insurance, and trading.
Collaborate closely with business units to understand needs and gather feedback to inform and enhance data science solutions.
Collect, preprocess, and analyze large datasets to train, validate, and deploy machine learning and AI models.
Ensure the robustness, scalability, and efficiency of models deployed in production environments.
Work with cross-functional teams to integrate data-driven solutions into existing systems and processes, or help define new ones.
Proactively research and evaluate emerging technologies to drive operational improvements.




Qualifications:

A Master's degree with 2-3 years of relevant experience, or a Ph.D., in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Machine Learning, or a related field.
Hands-on experience with Python and commonly used data science and machine learning frameworks.
Experience working with both structured and unstructured data, including data pipelines, ETL processes, and organizing data in databases, data warehouses, and data lakes.
Familiarity with computer vision and/or natural language processing techniques (nice-to-have).
Knowledge of mathematical programming and optimization techniques (nice-to-have).
Proven experience in designing and delivering end-to-end data-driven solutions.

Title: Data Science Internship (12 months)
Description:
Company Description

Welcome to Kanadevia Inova, a global innovation leader in the waste infrastructure space, where we believe in creating a sustainable future through technology and innovation.

Transforming Waste into Value

At Kanadevia Inova, we pride ourselves on being at the forefront of waste-to-X technology. We are not just waste managers; we are creators of value from what communities discard. Your role at Kanadevia Inova directly contributes to turning something once considered useless - waste - into something invaluable: energy, heat, hydrogen, fertilizer, and beyond.

Job Description

The Advanced Digitalization, of the Technology and Digitalization department, is developing innovative digital products to support our customers maximizing the performance of their plants. In this role you will be supporting R&D projects, under the supervision of Data Scientists, on the following tasks:


Support the specification of technical requirements and technical design of machine learning based products.
Conduct data exploration studies to develop concepts and validate ideas and hypotheses.
Contribute to the development of machine learning models.
Develop and maintain data labelling and annotation processes.
Develop and maintain product performance monitoring reports, focusing on machine learning performance metrics.
Contribute to the monitoring and maintenance of Azure cloud resources (e.g. Azure ML Studio).


Qualifications


Currently enrolled or completed BSc or MSc degree in a STEM degree (e.g. Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, Mechanical or Electronic Engineering)
Exposure to python from studies, internships, or any other practical experience
Good command of English
Self-motivation and disciplined work ethics with a strong interest in self-learning


Additional Information

We offer


Responsible challenge with diversified field of activity
Team-oriented working atmosphere in an international Company
Personal development opportunities through own Inova Academy
Opportunity to gain an insight into various technical disciplines
Excellent employment conditions
Attractive working place (central, good transport links)
Modern infrastructure


For HR agencies: Please note that we do not accept applications coming from agencies. Thank you.

Title: Senior Research Scientist (Foundational Research, Machine Learning)
Description:
Are you a curious and open-minded individual with an interest in state-of-the-art foundational machine learning research? Thomson Reuters Labs is seeking a Senior Research Scientist with a passion for solving challenging machine learning problems in a data-rich, complex academic environment.

What does Thomson Reuters Labs do? We experiment, we build, we deliver. We support the organization and our product teams through foundational research and development of new products and technologies. The Labs innovate collaboratively across our core segments in Legal, Tax & Accounting, Government, and Reuters News.‚ÄØ We undertake a diverse portfolio of projects while investing in long-term research for the future.

As a Senior Research Scientist, you will be part of a diverse global team of experts. We hire world-leading specialists in ML/NLP/GenAI, as well as Engineering, to drive the company‚Äôs leading internal AI model development, fueled by an unprecedented wealth of data and powered by state-of-the-art technical infrastructure. You will have the opportunity to publish your research findings as well as contribute to our proprietary AI model research & development. Thomson Reuters Labs is known for consistently delivering successful data-driven Artificial Intelligence solutions in support of high-growth products that serve Thomson Reuters customers in new and exciting ways.

About The Role‚ÄØ

In this opportunity, as Senior Research Scientist you will:

Innovate: You will have the opportunity to try new and/or innovate new ML/NLP/IR/GenAI approaches and enjoy mentoring by world-leading experts. You will contribute ideas and work on solving real-world challenges using a wealth of data not otherwise available.‚ÄØ

Experiment and Develop: You can be involved in the entire research & model development lifecycle, brainstorming, building, testing, and delivering high-quality reports at leading international academic conferences.

Collaborate: Working on a collaborative global team of research engineers both within Thomson Reuters and our academic patterns at world-leading universities.

About You

You're a fit for the role if your background includes:

Required Qualifications:


PhD student or recent graduate with research experience in a technical discipline.
First-author publications at relevant venues such as NeurIPS, ICML, ICLR, ACL, EMNLP, NAACL, ICLR, or similar.
Excellent communication skills to report and present research findings and developments clearly, both orally and in writing.
Curious and innovative disposition capable of devising novel, well-founded algorithmic solutions to relevant problems.
Self-driven attitude and ability to work with limited supervision.
Comfortable working in fast-paced, agile environments, managing uncertainty and ambiguity.



Preferred Qualifications:


Experience working on relevant state-of-the-art research topics in large language models (LLMs) such as alignment, hallucination detection and reduction, model compression, data-centric techniques, efficient fine-tuning, long context length, synthetic data, combination of LLMs with knowledge graphs etc.
Familiarity with cloud tools such as Amazon AWS, MS Azure, or Google Cloud.
Previous experience working on large-scale machine learning systems.
Strong software and/or infrastructure engineering skills, as evidenced by code contributions to popular open-source libraries.



Other key points:

Plenty of data, compute, and high-impact problems: Our scientists and engineers get to play with large datasets and discover new capabilities and insights in support of our high-impact products and customers. Thomson Reuters is best known for the globally respected Reuters News agency, but our company is also the leading source of information for legal, corporate, and tax & Accounting professionals. We have over‚ÄØ60,000 TBs‚ÄØworth of legal, regulatory, news, and tax data. We also provide access to all major cloud computing platforms to our researchers and engineers.

What‚Äôs in it For You?

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:


Hybrid Work Model: We‚Äôve adopted a flexible hybrid working environment for our office-based roles while delivering a seamless experience that is digitally and physically connected.
Wellbeing: Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: two company-wide Mental Health Days Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing.
Culture: Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more.
Learning & Development: LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters caf√© networking.
Social Impact: Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact.
Purpose Driven Work: We have a superpower that we‚Äôve never talked about with as much pride as we should ‚Äì we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency. Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.



DISCLAIMER

The above information in this description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this classification. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job.

Do you want to be part of a team helping re-invent the way knowledge professionals work? How about a team that works every day to create a more transparent, just and inclusive future? At Thomson Reuters, we‚Äôve been doing just that for almost 160 years. Our industry-leading products and services include highly specialized information-enabled software and tools for legal, tax, accounting and compliance professionals combined with the world‚Äôs most global news services ‚Äì Reuters. We help these professionals do their jobs better, creating more time for them to focus on the things that matter most: advising, advocating, negotiating, governing and informing.

We are powered by the talents of 25,000 employees across more than 75 countries, where everyone has a chance to contribute and grow professionally in flexible work environments that celebrate diversity and inclusion. At a time when objectivity, accuracy, fairness and transparency are under attack, we consider it our duty to pursue them. Sound exciting? Join us and help shape the industries that move society forward.

Accessibility

As a global business, we rely on diversity of culture and thought to deliver on our goals. To ensure we can do that, we seek talented, qualified employees in all our operations around the world regardless of race, color, sex/gender, including pregnancy, gender identity and expression, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, disability, age, marital status, citizen status, veteran status, or any other protected classification under applicable law. Thomson Reuters is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer providing a drug-free workplace.

We also make reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and for sincerely held religious beliefs in accordance with applicable law.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer (OSS) in a fast-growing AI Startup
Description:
At the ETH spin-off Lightly, we build software solutions to help companies improve their deep learning models. The available data for deep learning grows faster than human tagging and available compute power. Our customers already face this problem and have too much data to process. As a solution, we built software to identify and work with the most relevant samples only. Learn more about us on our website.




We are a team of talented developers and researchers in Zurich, Prague and San Francisco and are backed by YCombinator. Every member of the team is going to have a massive impact.




Thus, we are looking for an experienced engineer with lots of passion for the subject. We offer attractive cash- & equity package for you to become part-owner of Lightly. Remote work is also possible.




We use a modern stack of:





PyTorch, Python, Typescript, C++, Rust, React, NodeJS


Docker, Kubernetes, Google Cloud Platform, AWS



Tasks


As a Machine Learning Engineer in the core ML team, you will be part of a team which works mainly on our open-source package for self-supervised learning and similar internal frameworks.




Particularly, you will get to:





Work on our open-source Python package for self-supervised learning: https://github.com/lightly-ai/lightly.


Add support for finetuning pretrained models for downstream tasks including many different computer vision tasks like object detection, segmentation, tracking, and more.


Keep up with current research in self-supervised learning and multi-modal models.


All these tasks will include working with state-of-the-art technology such as self-supervised learning, model distillation, vision language models and deep learning for computer vision in general.


Participate in and hold paper sessions about the latest papers in the field.


Represent the company at machine learning conferences and engage with the community.





In general, for this role expect to use the stack we use for our open-source package https://github.com/lightly-ai/lightly.


Requirements


Ideally, you have:





MSc or PhD in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field


Experience in deep learning and computer vision, ideally in self-supervised learning and you have worked with PyTorch.


Excellent Python coding skills and knowledge of software engineering best practices. Experience with testing and typed Python is a big plus.


Experience with building and shipping software solutions.


Strong passion for new technologies and interest in keeping up with the latest technologies and publications in deep learning.



Benefits


We offer attractive cash- & equity package for you to become part-owner of Lightly. Remote work is also possible.




Interested? Contact us!




We look forward to getting to know you!

Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Job Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer

Location: Zurich / Remote

Contract: 6-month Freelance (with possibility of extension)




Company Overview:

DeepRec.ai is collaborating with a rapidly growing, innovative Biotech company focused on transforming Drug Discovery through AI. if you're passionate about AI for Science, we're seeking a Senior Machine Learning Engineer to join their growing team.




Job Description:

As a Senior Machine Learning Engineer, you will be joining a high-impact, mission-driven team working on the forefront of AI research. You'll have the opportunity to contribute to the development of generative modeling techniques and large language models. Your role will involve building and optimizing state-of-the-art deep learning models, deploying them at scale, and working in a collaborative environment with some of the best minds in AI and Biotech.

This is a unique opportunity to make a significant impact at a well-funded, fast-growing company that is defining the future of AI in the Biotech space.




Key Responsibilities:

Design, implement, and deploy machine learning models with a focus on large language models and generative modeling.
Fine-tune and optimize deep learning models at scale, applying advanced hyperparameter tuning techniques.
Collaborate closely with a highly skilled, interdisciplinary team of researchers, engineers, and Biotech experts to integrate AI solutions into real-world applications.
Drive continuous improvements in model performance and scalability.
Stay up-to-date with the latest research and technological advancements in AI/ML and contribute innovative ideas to the team.




Required Skills:

3+ years of industry experience in Machine Learning and AI.
Strong expertise in large language models (LLMs), including experience coding, deploying, evaluating, and fine-tuning these models.
Hands-on experience with deep learning frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, or similar, and a strong understanding of model training and evaluation.
Proficiency in deploying machine learning models at scale in cloud-based environments (AWS, GCP, Azure, etc.).
Experience with hyperparameter tuning and optimization techniques.
Solid understanding of machine learning algorithms and techniques, particularly in generative modeling and NLP.

Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
I am collaborating with a very exciting, incredibly well backed, start up, Biotech company with offices in Amsterdam and Zurich




They are building a cutting-edge data platform and developing a multimodal foundation model that leverages complex datasets to improve cancer diagnosis, treatment, and patient outcomes.

Oncology involves a complex interplay of data types‚Äîincluding medical imaging, pathology, genomics, clinical records, and patient histories. We are seeking visionary engineers to develop an agentic AI system capable of seamlessly integrating these modalities to support oncologists and enhance patient outcomes.




As part of the Agentic AI team, you will contribute to building a system that can process and reason across diverse medical data sources.




Key Responsibilities







Design and implement an agentic AI system that integrates and interprets multimodal oncology data, including medical imaging, pathology slides, genomic profiles, and clinical information.




Develop intelligent agent workflows that mirror the collaborative, multidisciplinary approach of oncology care teams and tumor boards.




Build and optimize systems that understand relationships across different data modalities, extracting clinically relevant insights.




Create evaluation frameworks to rigorously assess agent performance across real-world oncology scenarios.




Research and implement state-of-the-art AI techniques, leveraging Large Language Models (LLMs) and Vision-Language Models (VLMs) in agentic AI applications.







Your profile







Required Skills & Experience:




Strong programming skills in Python and PyTorch.
Deep understanding of transformer architectures and deep learning principles.
Experience training and fine-tuning foundation models.
Proficiency in prompting and developing applications with LLMs.
Solid grasp of LLM and VLM architectures and operations.







Nice to Have:




Experience with Agentic AI or familiarity with recent research in the field.
Experience in Reinforcement Learning.

Comprehensive salary
Long term incentives
25+ days holiday
Clear development pathway

I am collaborating with a very exciting, incredibly well backed, start up, Biotech company with offices in Amsterdam and Zurich


They are building a cutting-edge data platform and developing a multimodal foundation model that leverages complex datasets to improve cancer diagnosis, treatment, and patient outcomes.

Oncology involves a complex interplay of data types‚Äîincluding medical imaging, pathology, genomics, clinical records, and patient histories. We are seeking visionary engineers to develop an agentic AI system capable of seamlessly integrating these modalities to support oncologists and enhance patient outcomes.


As part of the Agentic AI team, you will contribute to building a system that can process and reason across diverse medical data sources.


Key Responsibilities



  • Design and implement an agentic AI system that integrates and interprets multimodal oncology data, including medical imaging, pathology slides, genomic profiles, and clinical information.


  • Develop intelligent agent workflows that mirror the collaborative, multidisciplinary approach of oncology care teams and tumor boards.


  • Build and optimize systems that understand relationships across different data modalities, extracting clinically relevant insights.


  • Create evaluation frameworks to rigorously assess agent performance across real-world oncology scenarios.


  • Research and implement state-of-the-art AI techniques, leveraging Large Language Models (LLMs) and Vision-Language Models (VLMs) in agentic AI applications.



Your profile



Required Skills & Experience:


  • Strong programming skills in Python and PyTorch.
  • Deep understanding of transformer architectures and deep learning principles.
  • Experience training and fine-tuning foundation models.
  • Proficiency in prompting and developing applications with LLMs.
  • Solid grasp of LLM and VLM architectures and operations.



Nice to Have:


  • Experience with Agentic AI or familiarity with recent research in the field.
  • Experience in Reinforcement Learning.



Benefits


  • Comprehensive salary
  • Long term incentives
  • 25+ days holiday

Title: ML Engineer - Agentic AI
Description:
About kaiko

In cancer care, treatment decisions can take many days‚Äîbut patients don‚Äôt have that time. One of the reasons for delays? Cancer patients' data is scattered across many places: doctor‚Äôs notes, medical imagery, genomics data. At kaiko, we are developing AI foundational models to bring this data together and integrate it into clinical workflows, enabling doctors to make faster, more effective treatments decisions.

We also collaborate closely with the leading Dutch cancer research institute (NKI) on multiple AI research projects and a joint clinical validation initiative. In 2025, we plan on expanding our partnerships to even more hospitals.

We raised significant long-term funding and have offices in Zurich and Amsterdam. Over the past year, our team has nearly doubled in size, now comprising 70+ people from 25 countries.




About the role

As oncology inherently involves numerous data types such as imaging, pathology, genomics, clinical data, and patient histories, we are looking for visionary engineers to help us create an agentic AI system that can seamlessly integrate these modalities to support oncologists and ultimately improve patient outcomes. You will be joining the agentic AI team, where you will help develop a system capable of processing and reasoning across these different data modalities. You will be based in Zurich, Switzerland, with the expectation of spending at least 50% of your time at the office.

Some areas of responsibility

Develop and implement an agentic AI system that can process and reason on multimodal oncology data including medical imaging, pathology slides, genomic profiles, and clinical information.
Create novel agent workflows that mimic the collaborative, multidisciplinary approach of tumor boards and oncology care teams.
Build and implement systems that can understand the relationships between different data types and extract clinically relevant insights.
Develop evaluation frameworks to rigorously test agent performance across diverse oncology scenarios.
Research and implement state-of-the-art techniques that leverage Large Language Models (LLMs) and Vision Language Models (VLMs) in agentic settings.




About you

Strong programing skills in Python and PyTorch
Strong foundation in deep learning, particularly in transformer architectures
Experience training and fine-tuning foundation models
Experience in prompting and/or developing products with LLMs
Familiarity with the architecture and operation of LLMs and VLMs

Nice to have:

Experience with Agentic AI or knowledge of recent literature
Experience with Reinforcement learning







Why kaiko

At kaiko, we believe the best ideas come from collaboration, ownership and ambition. We‚Äôve built a team of international experts where your work has direct impact. Here‚Äôs what we value:

Ownership: You‚Äôll have the autonomy to set your own goals, make critical decisions, and see the direct impact of your work.
Collaboration: You‚Äôll have to approach disagreement with curiosity, build on common ground and create solutions together.
Ambition: You‚Äôll be surrounded by people who set high standards for themselves and others, who see obstacles as opportunities, and who are relentless in their work to create better outcomes for patients.




In addition, we offer:

An attractive and competitive salary, a good pension plan and 25 vacation days per year.
Great offsites and team events to strengthen the team and celebrate successes together.
A EUR 1000 learning and development budget to help you grow.
Autonomy to do your work the way that works best for you, whether you have a kid or prefer early mornings.
An annual commuting subsidy.




We are excited to gather a broad range of perspectives in our team, as we believe it will help us build better products to support a broader set of people. If you‚Äôre excited about us but don‚Äôt fit every single qualification, we still encourage you to apply: we‚Äôve had incredible team members join us who didn‚Äôt check every box!

Title: Research Scientist
Description:
Overview

The‚ÄØ Microsoft Spatial AI Lab in Zurich , Switzerland, is a research and development team building the future of spatial computing. We are looking for computer vision and machine learning scientists who share our passion for developing innovative technology that can be deployed to the cloud and utilized by millions of users. We are based near ETH Zurich, the top technical school in continental Europe, enabling close collaboration in multiple areas.‚ÄØ

You will conduct research at the intersection of computer vision, machine learning/AI, robotics and cloud computing. This research will help humans and robotic agents to understand the environment, recognize objects, and perform tasks.‚ÄØ

This opportunity will allow you to grow your expertise in Spatial AI, learn more about deployment of algorithms to Copilot+ PC s with neural processing unit (NPU) or to cloud environments and supervise interns or be involved in joint research projects with ETH.‚ÄØ

Microsoft‚Äôs mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. As employees we come together with a growth mindset, innovate to empower others, and collaborate to realize our shared goals. Each day we build on our values of respect, integrity, and accountability to create a culture of inclusion where everyone can thrive at work and beyond.‚ÄØ

Responsibilities


Works within a team to achieve goals and objectives across services, including understanding user requirements, design, and coding.‚ÄØ
Brings the State of the Art to Products - collaborates in an interdisciplinary team to bridge the gap between research and development.‚ÄØ
Grows expertise in one or more subareas of research.‚ÄØ
Develops a deep understanding of tools, technologies and methods that can be utilized to deploy product-grade, robust and efficient code in the cloud.‚ÄØ
Grows our relationships with the research community. May contribute to publications, workshops, or the supervision of interns & PhD/MS students.‚ÄØ


Qualifications

Required Qualification(s):


PhD in Computer Vision or AI/Machine Learning or Robotics or similar professional experience.‚ÄØ
Demonstrated coding, debugging, and engineering skills in programming languages such as C++ or Python.‚ÄØ
Hands-on experience with deep learning and/or computer vision methods.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ
Self-motivated team-player, problem solver, and keen to learn.‚ÄØ
Ability to present complex technical concepts to a diverse audience.‚ÄØ


Preferred Qualifications:‚ÄØ


Prior research in one or more of the following areas:‚ÄØ
3D scene reasoning with open vocabularies, Vision-L anguage Models ( V LMs).‚ÄØ
Experience with deep learning models like transformers and attention mechanisms for sequence modeling.‚ÄØ
Video understanding, action and activity recognition.‚ÄØ
Experience with spatio-temporal feature extraction techniques.‚ÄØ
Object detection and semantic segmentation.‚ÄØ
Robot-environment / robot-human interaction, particularly through natural language.
Publication record at top-tier conferences and journals (e.g., CVPR, ECCV, ICCV,‚ÄØ NeurIPS, ICLR, CoRL).‚ÄØ


Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form .

Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.
